content: 1 Proverbs of Solomon, son of David, king of Israel:
content_old: 1 Proverbs of Solomon, son of David, king of Israel:

content: 2 to know wisdom and instruction; to discern the words of understanding;
content_old: 2 to know wisdom and instruction; to discern the words of understanding;

content: 3 to receive the instruction of wisdom, righteousness and judgment, and equity;
content_old: 3 to receive the instruction of wisdom, righteousness and judgment, and equity;

content: 4 to give prudence to the simple, to the young man knowledge and discretion.
content_old: 4 to give prudence to the simple, to the young man knowledge and discretion.

content: 5 He that is wise will hear, and will increase learning; and the intelligent will gain wise counsels:
content_old: 5 He that is wise will hear, and will increase learning; and the intelligent will gain wise counsels:

content: 6 to understand a proverb and an allegory, the words of the wise and their enigmas.
content_old: 6 to understand a proverb and an allegory, the words of the wise and their enigmas.

content: 7 The fear of Jehovah is the beginning of knowledge: fools despise wisdom and instruction.
content_old: 7 The fear of Jehovah is the beginning of knowledge: fools despise wisdom and instruction.

content: 8 Hear, my son, the instruction of thy father, and forsake not the teaching of thy mother;
content_old: 8 Hear, my son, the instruction of thy father, and forsake not the teaching of thy mother;

content: 9 for they shall be a garland of grace unto thy head, and chains about thy neck.
content_old: 9 for they shall be a garland of grace unto thy head, and chains about thy neck.

content: 10 My son, if sinners entice thee, consent not.
content_old: 10 My son, if sinners entice thee, consent not.

content: 11 If they say, Come with us, let us lay wait for blood, let us lurk secretly for the innocent without cause;
content_old: 11 If they say, Come with us, let us lay wait for blood, let us lurk secretly for the innocent without cause;

content: 12 let us swallow them up alive as Sheol, and whole, as those that go down into the pit;
content_old: 12 let us swallow them up alive as Sheol, and whole, as those that go down into the pit;

content: 13 we shall find all precious substance, we shall fill our houses with spoil:
content_old: 13 we shall find all precious substance, we shall fill our houses with spoil:

content: 14 cast in thy lot among us; we will all have one purse:
content_old: 14 cast in thy lot among us; we will all have one purse:

content: 15 —my son, walk not in the way with them, keep back thy foot from their path;
content_old: 15 —my son, walk not in the way with them, keep back thy foot from their path;

content: 16 for their feet run to evil, and they make haste to shed blood.
content_old: 16 for their feet run to evil, and they make haste to shed blood.

content: 17 For in vain the net is spread in the sight of anything which hath wings.
content_old: 17 For in vain the net is spread in the sight of anything which hath wings.

content: 18 And these lay wait for their own blood; they lurk secretly for their own lives.
content_old: 18 And these lay wait for their own blood; they lurk secretly for their own lives.

content: 19 So are the paths of every one that is greedy of gain: it taketh away the life of its possessors.
content_old: 19 So are the paths of every one that is greedy of gain: it taketh away the life of its possessors.

content: 20 Wisdom crieth without; she raiseth her voice in the broadways;
content_old: 20 Wisdom crieth without; she raiseth her voice in the broadways;

content: 21 she calleth in the chief place of concourse, in the entry of the gates; in the city she uttereth her words:
content_old: 21 she calleth in the chief place of concourse, in the entry of the gates; in the city she uttereth her words:

content: 22 How long, simple ones, will ye love simpleness, and scorners take pleasure in their scorning, and the foolish hate knowledge?
content_old: 22 How long, simple ones, will ye love simpleness, and scorners take pleasure in their scorning, and the foolish hate knowledge?

content: 23 Turn you at my reproof: behold, I will pour forth my spirit unto you, I will make known to you my words.
content_old: 23 Turn you at my reproof: behold, I will pour forth my spirit unto you, I will make known to you my words.

content: 24 Because I have called, and ye refused; I have stretched out my hand, and no one regarded;
content_old: 24 Because I have called, and ye refused; I have stretched out my hand, and no one regarded;

content: 25 and ye have rejected all my counsel, and would none of my reproof:
content_old: 25 and ye have rejected all my counsel, and would none of my reproof:

content: 26 I also will laugh in your calamity, I will mock when your fear cometh;
content_old: 26 I also will laugh in your calamity, I will mock when your fear cometh;

content: 27 when your fear cometh as sudden destruction, and your calamity cometh as a whirlwind; when distress and anguish come upon you:
content_old: 27 when your fear cometh as sudden destruction, and your calamity cometh as a whirlwind; when distress and anguish come upon you:

content: 28 —then will they call upon me, but I will not answer; they will seek me early, and shall not find me.
content_old: 28 —then will they call upon me, but I will not answer; they will seek me early, and shall not find me.

content: 29 Because they hated knowledge, and did not choose the fear of Jehovah;
content_old: 29 Because they hated knowledge, and did not choose the fear of Jehovah;

content: 30 they would none of my counsel, they despised all my reproof:
content_old: 30 they would none of my counsel, they despised all my reproof:

content: 31 therefore shall they eat of the fruit of their way, and be filled with their own devices.
content_old: 31 therefore shall they eat of the fruit of their way, and be filled with their own devices.

content: 32 For the turning away of the simple shall slay them, and the prosperity of the foolish shall cause them to perish.
content_old: 32 For the turning away of the simple shall slay them, and the prosperity of the foolish shall cause them to perish.

content: 1 My son, if thou receivest my words, and layest up my commandments with thee,
content_old: 1 My son, if thou receivest my words, and layest up my commandments with thee,

content: 2 so that thou incline thine ear unto wisdom and thou apply thy heart to understanding;
content_old: 2 so that thou incline thine ear unto wisdom and thou apply thy heart to understanding;

content: 3 yea, if thou criest after discernment and liftest up thy voice to understanding;
content_old: 3 yea, if thou criest after discernment and liftest up thy voice to understanding;

content: 4 if thou seekest her as silver and searchest for her as for hidden treasures:
content_old: 4 if thou seekest her as silver and searchest for her as for hidden treasures:

content: 5 then shalt thou understand the fear of Jehovah, and find the knowledge of God.
content_old: 5 then shalt thou understand the fear of Jehovah, and find the knowledge of God.

content: 6 For Jehovah giveth wisdom; out of his mouth come knowledge and understanding.
content_old: 6 For Jehovah giveth wisdom; out of his mouth come knowledge and understanding.

content: 7 He layeth up sound wisdom for the upright; he is a shield to them that walk in integrity;
content_old: 7 He layeth up sound wisdom for the upright; he is a shield to them that walk in integrity;

content: 8 guarding the paths of just judgment and keeping the way of his godly ones.
content_old: 8 guarding the paths of just judgment and keeping the way of his godly ones.

content: 9 Then shalt thou understand righteousness and judgment and equity: every good path.
content_old: 9 Then shalt thou understand righteousness and judgment and equity: every good path.

content: 10 When wisdom entereth into thy heart and knowledge is pleasant unto thy soul,
content_old: 10 When wisdom entereth into thy heart and knowledge is pleasant unto thy soul,

content: 11 discretion shall keep thee, understanding shall preserve thee:
content_old: 11 discretion shall keep thee, understanding shall preserve thee:

content: 12 To deliver thee from the way of evil, from the man that speaketh froward things;
content_old: 12 To deliver thee from the way of evil, from the man that speaketh froward things;

content: 13 from those who leave the paths of uprightness, to walk in the ways of darkness;
content_old: 13 from those who leave the paths of uprightness, to walk in the ways of darkness;

content: 14 who rejoice to do evil, and delight in the frowardness of evil;
content_old: 14 who rejoice to do evil, and delight in the frowardness of evil;

content: 15 whose paths are crooked, and who are perverted in their course:
content_old: 15 whose paths are crooked, and who are perverted in their course:

content: 16 To deliver thee from the strange woman, from the stranger who flattereth with her words;
content_old: 16 To deliver thee from the strange woman, from the stranger who flattereth with her words;

content: 17 who forsaketh the guide of her youth, and forgetteth the covenant of her God;
content_old: 17 who forsaketh the guide of her youth, and forgetteth the covenant of her God;

content: 18 —for her house inclineth unto death, and her paths unto the dead;
content_old: 18 —for her house inclineth unto death, and her paths unto the dead;

content: 19 none that go unto her return again, neither do they attain to the paths of life:
content_old: 19 none that go unto her return again, neither do they attain to the paths of life:

content: 20 —that thou mayest walk in the way of the good, and keep the paths of the righteous.
content_old: 20 —that thou mayest walk in the way of the good, and keep the paths of the righteous.

content: 21 For the upright shall dwell in the land, and the perfect shall remain in it;
content_old: 21 For the upright shall dwell in the land, and the perfect shall remain in it;

content: 1 My son, forget not my teaching, and let thy heart observe my commandments;
content_old: 1 My son, forget not my teaching, and let thy heart observe my commandments;

content: 2 for length of days, and years of life, and peace shall they add to thee.
content_old: 2 for length of days, and years of life, and peace shall they add to thee.

content: 3 Let not loving-kindness and truth forsake thee; bind them about thy neck, write them upon the tablet of thy heart:
content_old: 3 Let not loving-kindness and truth forsake thee; bind them about thy neck, write them upon the tablet of thy heart:

content: 4 and thou shalt find favour and good understanding in the sight of God and man.
content_old: 4 and thou shalt find favour and good understanding in the sight of God and man.

content: 5 Confide in Jehovah with all thy heart, and lean not unto thine own intelligence;
content_old: 5 Confide in Jehovah with all thy heart, and lean not unto thine own intelligence;

content: 6 in all thy ways acknowledge him, and he will make plain thy paths.
content_old: 6 in all thy ways acknowledge him, and he will make plain thy paths.

content: 7 Be not wise in thine own eyes; fear Jehovah, and depart from evil:
content_old: 7 Be not wise in thine own eyes; fear Jehovah, and depart from evil:

content: 8 it shall be health for thy navel, and moisture for thy bones.
content_old: 8 it shall be health for thy navel, and moisture for thy bones.

content: 9 Honour Jehovah with thy substance, and with the first-fruits of all thine increase;
content_old: 9 Honour Jehovah with thy substance, and with the first-fruits of all thine increase;

content: 10 so shall thy barns be filled with plenty, and thy vats shall overflow with new wine.
content_old: 10 so shall thy barns be filled with plenty, and thy vats shall overflow with new wine.

content: 11 My son, despise not the instruction of Jehovah, neither be weary of his chastisement;
content_old: 11 My son, despise not the instruction of Jehovah, neither be weary of his chastisement;

content: 12 for whom Jehovah loveth he chasteneth, even as a father the son in whom he delighteth.
content_old: 12 for whom Jehovah loveth he chasteneth, even as a father the son in whom he delighteth.

content: 13 Blessed is the man that findeth wisdom, and the man that getteth understanding.
content_old: 13 Blessed is the man that findeth wisdom, and the man that getteth understanding.

content: 14 For the gain thereof is better than the gain of silver, and her revenue than fine gold.
content_old: 14 For the gain thereof is better than the gain of silver, and her revenue than fine gold.

content: 15 She is more precious than rubies; and all the things thou canst desire are not equal unto her.
content_old: 15 She is more precious than rubies; and all the things thou canst desire are not equal unto her.

content: 16 Length of days is in her right hand; in her left hand riches and honour.
content_old: 16 Length of days is in her right hand; in her left hand riches and honour.

content: 17 Her ways are ways of pleasantness, and all her paths are peace.
content_old: 17 Her ways are ways of pleasantness, and all her paths are peace.

content: 18 She is a tree of life to them that lay hold upon her; and happy is he that retaineth her.
content_old: 18 She is a tree of life to them that lay hold upon her; and happy is he that retaineth her.

content: 19 Jehovah by wisdom founded the earth; by understanding he established the heavens.
content_old: 19 Jehovah by wisdom founded the earth; by understanding he established the heavens.

content: 20 By his knowledge the deeps were broken up, and the skies drop down the dew.
content_old: 20 By his knowledge the deeps were broken up, and the skies drop down the dew.

content: 21 My son, let them not depart from thine eyes; keep sound wisdom and discretion:
content_old: 21 My son, let them not depart from thine eyes; keep sound wisdom and discretion:

content: 22 so shall they be life unto thy soul, and grace unto thy neck.
content_old: 22 so shall they be life unto thy soul, and grace unto thy neck.

content: 23 Then shalt thou walk in thy way securely, and thy foot shall not stumble;
content_old: 23 Then shalt thou walk in thy way securely, and thy foot shall not stumble;

content: 24 when thou liest down, thou shalt not be afraid, but thou shalt lie down and thy sleep shall be sweet.
content_old: 24 when thou liest down, thou shalt not be afraid, but thou shalt lie down and thy sleep shall be sweet.

content: 25 Be not afraid of sudden fear, neither of the destruction of the wicked, when it cometh;
content_old: 25 Be not afraid of sudden fear, neither of the destruction of the wicked, when it cometh;

content: 26 for Jehovah shall be thy confidence, and he will keep thy foot from being taken.
content_old: 26 for Jehovah shall be thy confidence, and he will keep thy foot from being taken.

content: 27 Withhold not good from them to whom it is due, when it is in the power of thy hand to do it.
content_old: 27 Withhold not good from them to whom it is due, when it is in the power of thy hand to do it.

content: 28 Say not unto thy neighbour, Go, and come again, and to-morrow I will give, when thou hast it by thee.
content_old: 28 Say not unto thy neighbour, Go, and come again, and to-morrow I will give, when thou hast it by thee.

content: 29 Devise not evil against thy neighbour, seeing he dwelleth securely by thee.
content_old: 29 Devise not evil against thy neighbour, seeing he dwelleth securely by thee.

content: 30 Strive not with a man without cause, if he have done thee no harm.
content_old: 30 Strive not with a man without cause, if he have done thee no harm.

content: 31 Envy not the man of violence, and choose none of his ways.
content_old: 31 Envy not the man of violence, and choose none of his ways.

content: 32 For the perverse is an abomination to Jehovah; but his secret is with the upright.
content_old: 32 For the perverse is an abomination to Jehovah; but his secret is with the upright.

content: 33 The curse of Jehovah is in the house of the wicked; but he blesseth the habitation of the righteous.
content_old: 33 The curse of Jehovah is in the house of the wicked; but he blesseth the habitation of the righteous.

content: 34 He indeed scorneth the scorners; but he giveth grace unto the lowly.
content_old: 34 He indeed scorneth the scorners; but he giveth grace unto the lowly.

content: 1 Hear, ye children, the instruction of a father, and attend to know intelligence;
content_old: 1 Hear, ye children, the instruction of a father, and attend to know intelligence;

content: 2 for I give you good doctrine: forsake ye not my law.
content_old: 2 for I give you good doctrine: forsake ye not my law.

content: 3 For I was a son unto my father, tender and an only one in the sight of my mother.
content_old: 3 For I was a son unto my father, tender and an only one in the sight of my mother.

content: 4 And he taught me, and said unto me, Let thy heart retain my words; keep my commandments and live.
content_old: 4 And he taught me, and said unto me, Let thy heart retain my words; keep my commandments and live.

content: 5 Get wisdom, get intelligence: forget it not; neither decline from the words of my mouth.
content_old: 5 Get wisdom, get intelligence: forget it not; neither decline from the words of my mouth.

content: 6 Forsake her not, and she shall keep thee; love her, and she shall preserve thee.
content_old: 6 Forsake her not, and she shall keep thee; love her, and she shall preserve thee.

content: 7 The beginning of wisdom is, Get wisdom; and with all thy getting get intelligence.
content_old: 7 The beginning of wisdom is, Get wisdom; and with all thy getting get intelligence.

content: 8 Exalt her, and she shall promote thee; she shall bring thee to honour when thou dost embrace her.
content_old: 8 Exalt her, and she shall promote thee; she shall bring thee to honour when thou dost embrace her.

content: 9 She shall give to thy head a garland of grace; a crown of glory will she bestow upon thee.
content_old: 9 She shall give to thy head a garland of grace; a crown of glory will she bestow upon thee.

content: 10 Hear, my son, and receive my sayings, and the years of thy life shall be multiplied.
content_old: 10 Hear, my son, and receive my sayings, and the years of thy life shall be multiplied.

content: 11 I will teach thee in the way of wisdom, I will lead thee in paths of uprightness.
content_old: 11 I will teach thee in the way of wisdom, I will lead thee in paths of uprightness.

content: 12 When thou goest, thy steps shall not be straitened; and when thou runnest, thou shalt not stumble.
content_old: 12 When thou goest, thy steps shall not be straitened; and when thou runnest, thou shalt not stumble.

content: 13 Take fast hold of instruction, let her not go: keep her, for she is thy life.
content_old: 13 Take fast hold of instruction, let her not go: keep her, for she is thy life.

content: 14 Enter not into the path of the wicked, and go not in the way of evil men:
content_old: 14 Enter not into the path of the wicked, and go not in the way of evil men:

content: 15 avoid it, pass not by it; turn from it, and pass away.
content_old: 15 avoid it, pass not by it; turn from it, and pass away.

content: 16 For they sleep not except they have done mischief, and their sleep is taken away unless they have caused some to fall.
content_old: 16 For they sleep not except they have done mischief, and their sleep is taken away unless they have caused some to fall.

content: 17 For they eat the bread of wickedness, and drink the wine of violence.
content_old: 17 For they eat the bread of wickedness, and drink the wine of violence.

content: 18 But the path of the righteous is as the shining light, going on and brightening until the day be fully come.
content_old: 18 But the path of the righteous is as the shining light, going on and brightening until the day be fully come.

content: 19 The way of the wicked is as darkness: they know not at what they stumble.
content_old: 19 The way of the wicked is as darkness: they know not at what they stumble.

content: 20 My son, attend to my words; incline thine ear unto my sayings.
content_old: 20 My son, attend to my words; incline thine ear unto my sayings.

content: 21 Let them not depart from thine eyes; keep them in the midst of thy heart.
content_old: 21 Let them not depart from thine eyes; keep them in the midst of thy heart.

content: 22 For they are life unto those that find them, and health to all their flesh.
content_old: 22 For they are life unto those that find them, and health to all their flesh.

content: 23 Keep thy heart more than anything that is guarded; for out of it are the issues of life.
content_old: 23 Keep thy heart more than anything that is guarded; for out of it are the issues of life.

content: 24 Put away from thee perverseness of mouth, and corrupt lips put far from thee.
content_old: 24 Put away from thee perverseness of mouth, and corrupt lips put far from thee.

content: 25 Let thine eyes look right on, and let thine eyelids look straight before thee.
content_old: 25 Let thine eyes look right on, and let thine eyelids look straight before thee.

content: 26 Ponder the path of thy feet, and let all thy ways be well-ordered.
content_old: 26 Ponder the path of thy feet, and let all thy ways be well-ordered.

content: 1 My son, attend unto my wisdom, incline thine ear to my understanding;
content_old: 1 My son, attend unto my wisdom, incline thine ear to my understanding;

content: 2 that thou mayest keep reflection, and that thy lips may preserve knowledge.
content_old: 2 that thou mayest keep reflection, and that thy lips may preserve knowledge.

content: 3 For the lips of the strange woman drop honey, and her mouth is smoother than oil;
content_old: 3 For the lips of the strange woman drop honey, and her mouth is smoother than oil;

content: 4 but her end is bitter as wormwood, sharp as a two-edged sword.
content_old: 4 but her end is bitter as wormwood, sharp as a two-edged sword.

content: 5 Her feet go down to death; her steps take hold on Sheol.
content_old: 5 Her feet go down to death; her steps take hold on Sheol.

content: 6 Lest she should ponder the path of life, her ways wander, she knoweth not whither.
content_old: 6 Lest she should ponder the path of life, her ways wander, she knoweth not whither.

content: 7 And now, children, hearken unto me, and depart not from the words of my mouth.
content_old: 7 And now, children, hearken unto me, and depart not from the words of my mouth.

content: 8 Remove thy way far from her, and come not nigh the door of her house:
content_old: 8 Remove thy way far from her, and come not nigh the door of her house:

content: 9 lest thou give thine honour unto others, and thy years unto the cruel;
content_old: 9 lest thou give thine honour unto others, and thy years unto the cruel;

content: 10 lest strangers be filled with thy wealth, and the fruits of thy toil come into the house of a stranger;
content_old: 10 lest strangers be filled with thy wealth, and the fruits of thy toil come into the house of a stranger;

content: 11 and thou mourn in thine end, when thy flesh and thy body are consumed;
content_old: 11 and thou mourn in thine end, when thy flesh and thy body are consumed;

content: 12 and thou say, How have I hated instruction, and my heart despised reproof!
content_old: 12 and thou say, How have I hated instruction, and my heart despised reproof!

content: 13 and I have not hearkened unto the voice of my teachers, nor inclined mine ear to those that instructed me;
content_old: 13 and I have not hearkened unto the voice of my teachers, nor inclined mine ear to those that instructed me;

content: 14 I was well nigh in all evil in the midst of the congregation and assembly.
content_old: 14 I was well nigh in all evil in the midst of the congregation and assembly.

content: 15 Drink waters out of thine own cistern, and running waters out of thine own well.
content_old: 15 Drink waters out of thine own cistern, and running waters out of thine own well.

content: 16 Thy fountains shall be poured forth, as water-brooks in the broadways.
content_old: 16 Thy fountains shall be poured forth, as water-brooks in the broadways.

content: 17 Let them be only thine own, and not strangers’ with thee.
content_old: 17 Let them be only thine own, and not strangers’ with thee.

content: 18 Let thy fountain be blessed; and have joy of the wife of thy youth.
content_old: 18 Let thy fountain be blessed; and have joy of the wife of thy youth.

content: 19 As a lovely hind and a graceful roe, let her breasts satisfy thee at all times: be thou ravished continually with her love.
content_old: 19 As a lovely hind and a graceful roe, let her breasts satisfy thee at all times: be thou ravished continually with her love.

content: 20 And why shouldest thou, my son, be ravished with a strange woman, and embrace the bosom of a stranger?
content_old: 20 And why shouldest thou, my son, be ravished with a strange woman, and embrace the bosom of a stranger?

content: 21 For the ways of man are before the eyes of Jehovah, and he pondereth all his paths.
content_old: 21 For the ways of man are before the eyes of Jehovah, and he pondereth all his paths.

content: 22 His own iniquities shall take the wicked, and he shall be holden with the cords of his sin.
content_old: 22 His own iniquities shall take the wicked, and he shall be holden with the cords of his sin.

content: 1 My son, if thou hast become surety for thy friend, if thou hast stricken thy hand for a stranger,
content_old: 1 My son, if thou hast become surety for thy friend, if thou hast stricken thy hand for a stranger,

content: 2 thou art snared with the words of thy mouth, thou art taken with the words of thy mouth.
content_old: 2 thou art snared with the words of thy mouth, thou art taken with the words of thy mouth.

content: 3 Do this now, my son, and deliver thyself, since thou hast come into the hand of thy friend: go, humble thyself, and be urgent with thy friend.
content_old: 3 Do this now, my son, and deliver thyself, since thou hast come into the hand of thy friend: go, humble thyself, and be urgent with thy friend.

content: 4 Give not sleep to thine eyes, nor slumber to thine eyelids:
content_old: 4 Give not sleep to thine eyes, nor slumber to thine eyelids:

content: 5 deliver thyself as a gazelle from the hand of the hunter, and as a bird from the hand of the fowler.
content_old: 5 deliver thyself as a gazelle from the hand of the hunter, and as a bird from the hand of the fowler.

content: 6 Go to the ant, thou sluggard; consider her ways and be wise:
content_old: 6 Go to the ant, thou sluggard; consider her ways and be wise:

content: 7 which having no chief, overseer, or ruler,
content_old: 7 which having no chief, overseer, or ruler,

content: 8 provideth her bread in the summer, and gathereth her food in the harvest.
content_old: 8 provideth her bread in the summer, and gathereth her food in the harvest.

content: 9 How long, sluggard, wilt thou lie down? When wilt thou arise out of thy sleep?
content_old: 9 How long, sluggard, wilt thou lie down? When wilt thou arise out of thy sleep?

content: 10 A little sleep, a little slumber, a little folding of the hands to rest!
content_old: 10 A little sleep, a little slumber, a little folding of the hands to rest!

content: 11 So shall thy poverty come as a roving plunderer, and thy penury as an armed man.
content_old: 11 So shall thy poverty come as a roving plunderer, and thy penury as an armed man.

content: 12 A man of Belial, a wicked person, is he that goeth about with a perverse mouth;
content_old: 12 A man of Belial, a wicked person, is he that goeth about with a perverse mouth;

content: 13 he winketh with his eyes, he speaketh with his feet, he teacheth with his fingers;
content_old: 13 he winketh with his eyes, he speaketh with his feet, he teacheth with his fingers;

content: 14 deceits are in his heart; he deviseth mischief at all times, he soweth discords.
content_old: 14 deceits are in his heart; he deviseth mischief at all times, he soweth discords.

content: 15 Therefore shall his calamity come suddenly: in a moment shall he be broken, and without remedy.
content_old: 15 Therefore shall his calamity come suddenly: in a moment shall he be broken, and without remedy.

content: 16 These six things doth Jehovah hate, yea, seven are an abomination unto him:
content_old: 16 These six things doth Jehovah hate, yea, seven are an abomination unto him:

content: 17 haughty eyes, a lying tongue, and hands that shed innocent blood;
content_old: 17 haughty eyes, a lying tongue, and hands that shed innocent blood;

content: 18 a heart that deviseth wicked imaginations; feet that are swift in running to mischief;
content_old: 18 a heart that deviseth wicked imaginations; feet that are swift in running to mischief;

content: 19 a false witness that uttereth lies, and he that soweth discords among brethren.
content_old: 19 a false witness that uttereth lies, and he that soweth discords among brethren.

content: 20 My son, observe thy father’s commandment, and forsake not the teaching of thy mother;
content_old: 20 My son, observe thy father’s commandment, and forsake not the teaching of thy mother;

content: 21 bind them continually upon thy heart, tie them about thy neck:
content_old: 21 bind them continually upon thy heart, tie them about thy neck:

content: 22 when thou walkest, it shall lead thee; when thou sleepest, it shall keep thee; and when thou awakest, it shall talk with thee.
content_old: 22 when thou walkest, it shall lead thee; when thou sleepest, it shall keep thee; and when thou awakest, it shall talk with thee.

content: 23 For the commandment is a lamp, and the teaching a light, and reproofs of instruction are the way of life:
content_old: 23 For the commandment is a lamp, and the teaching a light, and reproofs of instruction are the way of life:

content: 24 to keep thee from the evil woman, from the flattery of the tongue of a strange woman.
content_old: 24 to keep thee from the evil woman, from the flattery of the tongue of a strange woman.

content: 25 Lust not after her beauty in thy heart, neither let her take thee with her eyelids;
content_old: 25 Lust not after her beauty in thy heart, neither let her take thee with her eyelids;

content: 26 for by means of a whorish woman a man is brought to a loaf of bread, and another’s wife doth hunt for the precious soul.
content_old: 26 for by means of a whorish woman a man is brought to a loaf of bread, and another’s wife doth hunt for the precious soul.

content: 27 Can a man take fire in his bosom, and his garments not be burned?

content: 28 Can one go upon hot coals, and his feet not be scorched?
content_old: 28 Can one go upon hot coals, and his feet not be scorched?

content: 29 So he that goeth in to his neighbour’s wife: whosoever toucheth her shall not be innocent.
content_old: 29 So he that goeth in to his neighbour’s wife: whosoever toucheth her shall not be innocent.

content: 30 They do not despise a thief, if he steal to satisfy his soul when he is hungry:
content_old: 30 They do not despise a thief, if he steal to satisfy his soul when he is hungry:

content: 31 and if he be found, he shall restore sevenfold; he shall give all the substance of his house.

content: 32 Whoso committeth adultery with a woman is void of understanding: he that doeth it destroyeth his own soul.

content: 33 A wound and contempt shall he get; and his reproach shall not be wiped away.
content_old: 33 A wound and contempt shall he get; and his reproach shall not be wiped away.

content: 34 For jealousy is the rage of a man, and he will not spare in the day of vengeance;

content: 1 My son, keep my words, and lay up my commandments with thee.
content_old: 1 My son, keep my words, and lay up my commandments with thee.

content: 2 Keep my commandments, and live; and my teaching, as the apple of thine eye.
content_old: 2 Keep my commandments, and live; and my teaching, as the apple of thine eye.

content: 3 Bind them upon thy fingers, write them upon the tablet of thy heart.
content_old: 3 Bind them upon thy fingers, write them upon the tablet of thy heart.

content: 4 Say unto wisdom, Thou art my sister, and call intelligence thy kinswoman:
content_old: 4 Say unto wisdom, Thou art my sister, and call intelligence thy kinswoman:

content: 5 that they may keep thee from the strange woman, from the stranger who flattereth with her words.
content_old: 5 that they may keep thee from the strange woman, from the stranger who flattereth with her words.

content: 6 For at the window of my house, I looked forth through my lattice,
content_old: 6 For at the window of my house, I looked forth through my lattice,

content: 7 and I beheld among the simple ones, I discerned among the sons, a young man void of understanding,
content_old: 7 and I beheld among the simple ones, I discerned among the sons, a young man void of understanding,

content: 8 passing through the street near her corner; and he went the way to her house,

content: 9 in the twilight, in the evening of the day, in the blackness of night and the darkness.
content_old: 9 in the twilight, in the evening of the day, in the blackness of night and the darkness.

content: 10 And behold, there met him a woman in the attire of a harlot, and subtle of heart.
content_old: 10 And behold, there met him a woman in the attire of a harlot, and subtle of heart.

content: 11 She is clamorous and unmanageable; her feet abide not in her house:
content_old: 11 She is clamorous and unmanageable; her feet abide not in her house:

content: 12 now without, now in the broadways, —and she lieth in wait at every corner.
content_old: 12 now without, now in the broadways, —and she lieth in wait at every corner.

content: 13 And she caught him and kissed him, and with an impudent face said unto him,
content_old: 13 And she caught him and kissed him, and with an impudent face said unto him,

content: 14 I have peace-offerings with me; this day have I paid my vows:
content_old: 14 I have peace-offerings with me; this day have I paid my vows:

content: 15 therefore came I forth to meet thee, to seek earnestly thy face, and I have found thee.
content_old: 15 therefore came I forth to meet thee, to seek earnestly thy face, and I have found thee.

content: 16 I have decked my bed with tapestry coverlets of variegated linen from Egypt;
content_old: 16 I have decked my bed with tapestry coverlets of variegated linen from Egypt;

content: 17 I have perfumed my couch with myrrh, aloes, and cinnamon.
content_old: 17 I have perfumed my couch with myrrh, aloes, and cinnamon.

content: 18 Come, let us revel in love until the morning, let us delight ourselves with loves.
content_old: 18 Come, let us revel in love until the morning, let us delight ourselves with loves.

content: 19 For the husband is not at home, he is gone a long journey;
content_old: 19 For the husband is not at home, he is gone a long journey;

content: 20 he hath taken the money-bag with him, he will come home on the day of the full moon.
content_old: 20 he hath taken the money-bag with him, he will come home on the day of the full moon.

content: 21 With her much enticement she beguiled him; with the smoothness of her lips she constrained him.
content_old: 21 With her much enticement she beguiled him; with the smoothness of her lips she constrained him.

content: 22 He went after her straightway, as an ox goeth to the slaughter, and as stocks serve for the correction of the fool;
content_old: 22 He went after her straightway, as an ox goeth to the slaughter, and as stocks serve for the correction of the fool;

content: 23 till an arrow strike through his liver: as a bird hasteth to the snare, and knoweth not that it is for its life.

content: 24 And now, ye sons, hearken unto me, and attend to the words of my mouth.
content_old: 24 And now, ye sons, hearken unto me, and attend to the words of my mouth.

content: 25 Let not thy heart decline to her ways, go not astray in her paths:
content_old: 25 Let not thy heart decline to her ways, go not astray in her paths:

content: 26 for she hath cast down many wounded, and all slain by her were strong.

content: 1 Doth not wisdom cry? and understanding give forth her voice?
content_old: 1 Doth not wisdom cry? and understanding give forth her voice?

content: 2 On the top of high places by the way, at the cross-paths she taketh her stand.
content_old: 2 On the top of high places by the way, at the cross-paths she taketh her stand.

content: 3 Beside the gates, at the entry of the city, at the coming in at the doors, she crieth aloud.
content_old: 3 Beside the gates, at the entry of the city, at the coming in at the doors, she crieth aloud.

content: 4 Unto you, men, I call, and my voice is to the sons of man:
content_old: 4 Unto you, men, I call, and my voice is to the sons of man:

content: 5 O ye simple, understand prudence; and ye foolish, understand sense.
content_old: 5 O ye simple, understand prudence; and ye foolish, understand sense.

content: 6 Hear, for I will speak excellent things, and the opening of my lips shall be right things.
content_old: 6 Hear, for I will speak excellent things, and the opening of my lips shall be right things.

content: 7 For my palate shall meditate truth, and wickedness is an abomination to my lips.
content_old: 7 For my palate shall meditate truth, and wickedness is an abomination to my lips.

content: 8 All the words of my mouth are in righteousness; there is nothing tortuous or perverse in them.
content_old: 8 All the words of my mouth are in righteousness; there is nothing tortuous or perverse in them.

content: 9 They are all plain to him that understandeth, and right to them that find knowledge.
content_old: 9 They are all plain to him that understandeth, and right to them that find knowledge.

content: 10 Receive my instruction, and not silver; and knowledge rather than choice gold:
content_old: 10 Receive my instruction, and not silver; and knowledge rather than choice gold:

content: 11 for wisdom is better than rubies, and all the things that may be desired are not equal to it.
content_old: 11 for wisdom is better than rubies, and all the things that may be desired are not equal to it.

content: 12 I wisdom dwell with prudence, and find the knowledge which cometh of reflection.
content_old: 12 I wisdom dwell with prudence, and find the knowledge which cometh of reflection.

content: 13 The fear of Jehovah is to hate evil; pride, and arrogancy, and the evil way, and the froward mouth do I hate.
content_old: 13 The fear of Jehovah is to hate evil; pride, and arrogancy, and the evil way, and the froward mouth do I hate.

content: 14 Counsel is mine, and sound wisdom: I am intelligence; I have strength.
content_old: 14 Counsel is mine, and sound wisdom: I am intelligence; I have strength.

content: 15 By me kings reign, and rulers make just decrees;
content_old: 15 By me kings reign, and rulers make just decrees;

content: 16 by me princes rule, and nobles, all the judges of the earth.
content_old: 16 by me princes rule, and nobles, all the judges of the earth.

content: 17 I love those that love me; and they that seek me early shall find me.
content_old: 17 I love those that love me; and they that seek me early shall find me.

content: 18 Riches and honour are with me; durable wealth and righteousness.
content_old: 18 Riches and honour are with me; durable wealth and righteousness.

content: 19 My fruit is better than fine gold, yea, than pure gold; and my revenue than choice silver.
content_old: 19 My fruit is better than fine gold, yea, than pure gold; and my revenue than choice silver.

content: 20 I walk in the path of righteousness, in the midst of the paths of judgment:
content_old: 20 I walk in the path of righteousness, in the midst of the paths of judgment:

content: 21 that I may cause those that love me to inherit substance; and I will fill their treasuries.
content_old: 21 that I may cause those that love me to inherit substance; and I will fill their treasuries.

content: 22 Jehovah possessed me in the beginning of his way, before his works of old.
content_old: 22 Jehovah possessed me in the beginning of his way, before his works of old.

content: 23 I was set up from eternity, from the beginning, before the earth was.
content_old: 23 I was set up from eternity, from the beginning, before the earth was.

content: 24 When there were no depths, I was brought forth, when there were no fountains abounding with water.
content_old: 24 When there were no depths, I was brought forth, when there were no fountains abounding with water.

content: 25 Before the mountains were settled, before the hills was I brought forth;
content_old: 25 Before the mountains were settled, before the hills was I brought forth;

content: 26 while as yet he had not made the earth, nor the fields, nor the beginning of the dust of the world.
content_old: 26 while as yet he had not made the earth, nor the fields, nor the beginning of the dust of the world.

content: 27 When he prepared the heavens I was there; when he ordained the circle upon the face of the deep;
content_old: 27 When he prepared the heavens I was there; when he ordained the circle upon the face of the deep;

content: 28 when he established the skies above, when the fountains of the deep became strong;
content_old: 28 when he established the skies above, when the fountains of the deep became strong;

content: 29 when he imposed on the sea his decree that the waters should not pass his commandment, when he appointed the foundations of the earth:
content_old: 29 when he imposed on the sea his decree that the waters should not pass his commandment, when he appointed the foundations of the earth:

content: 30 then I was by him his nursling, and I was daily his delight, rejoicing always before him;
content_old: 30 then I was by him his nursling, and I was daily his delight, rejoicing always before him;

content: 31 rejoicing in the habitable part of his earth, and my delights were with the sons of men.
content_old: 31 rejoicing in the habitable part of his earth, and my delights were with the sons of men.

content: 32 And now, sons, hearken unto me, and blessed are they that keep my ways:
content_old: 32 And now, sons, hearken unto me, and blessed are they that keep my ways:

content: 33 hear instruction and be wise, and refuse it not.
content_old: 33 hear instruction and be wise, and refuse it not.

content: 34 Blessed is the man that heareth me, watching daily at my gates, waiting at the posts of my doors.
content_old: 34 Blessed is the man that heareth me, watching daily at my gates, waiting at the posts of my doors.

content: 35 For whoso findeth me findeth life, and obtaineth favour of Jehovah;
content_old: 35 For whoso findeth me findeth life, and obtaineth favour of Jehovah;

content: 1 Wisdom hath built her house, she hath hewn out her seven pillars;
content_old: 1 Wisdom hath built her house, she hath hewn out her seven pillars;

content: 2 she hath slaughtered her cattle, she hath mingled her wine, she hath also prepared her table;
content_old: 2 she hath slaughtered her cattle, she hath mingled her wine, she hath also prepared her table;

content: 3 she hath sent forth her maidens: she crieth upon the summits of the high places of the city,
content_old: 3 she hath sent forth her maidens: she crieth upon the summits of the high places of the city,

content: 4 Whoso is simple, let him turn in hither. To him that is void of understanding, she saith,
content_old: 4 Whoso is simple, let him turn in hither. To him that is void of understanding, she saith,

content: 5 Come, eat ye of my bread, and drink of the wine that I have mingled.
content_old: 5 Come, eat ye of my bread, and drink of the wine that I have mingled.

content: 6 Forsake follies and live, and go in the way of intelligence.
content_old: 6 Forsake follies and live, and go in the way of intelligence.

content: 7 He that instructeth a scorner getteth to himself shame; and he that reproveth a wicked man getteth to himself a blot.
content_old: 7 He that instructeth a scorner getteth to himself shame; and he that reproveth a wicked man getteth to himself a blot.

content: 8 Reprove not a scorner, lest he hate thee; reprove a wise man, and he will love thee.
content_old: 8 Reprove not a scorner, lest he hate thee; reprove a wise man, and he will love thee.

content: 9 Impart to a wise man, and he will become yet wiser; teach a righteous man, and he will increase learning.
content_old: 9 Impart to a wise man, and he will become yet wiser; teach a righteous man, and he will increase learning.

content: 10 The fear of Jehovah is the beginning of wisdom; and the knowledge of the Holy is intelligence.
content_old: 10 The fear of Jehovah is the beginning of wisdom; and the knowledge of the Holy is intelligence.

content: 11 For by me thy days shall be multiplied, and years of life shall be added to thee.
content_old: 11 For by me thy days shall be multiplied, and years of life shall be added to thee.

content: 12 If thou art wise, thou shalt be wise for thyself; and if thou scornest, thou alone shalt bear it.
content_old: 12 If thou art wise, thou shalt be wise for thyself; and if thou scornest, thou alone shalt bear it.

content: 13 The foolish woman is clamorous; she is stupid, and knoweth nothing.

content: 15 to call passers-by who go right on their ways:

content: 1 The Proverbs of Solomon. A wise son maketh a glad father; but a foolish son is the grief of his mother.
content_old: 1 The Proverbs of Solomon. A wise son maketh a glad father; but a foolish son is the grief of his mother.

content: 2 Treasures of wickedness profit nothing; but righteousness delivereth from death.
content_old: 2 Treasures of wickedness profit nothing; but righteousness delivereth from death.

content: 3 Jehovah suffereth not the soul of the righteous man to famish; but he repelleth the craving of the wicked.
content_old: 3 Jehovah suffereth not the soul of the righteous man to famish; but he repelleth the craving of the wicked.

content: 4 He cometh to want that dealeth with a slack hand; but the hand of the diligent maketh rich.
content_old: 4 He cometh to want that dealeth with a slack hand; but the hand of the diligent maketh rich.

content: 5 He that gathereth in summer is a wise son; he that sleepeth in harvest is a son that causeth shame.
content_old: 5 He that gathereth in summer is a wise son; he that sleepeth in harvest is a son that causeth shame.

content: 6 Blessings are upon the head of a righteous man; but the mouth of the wicked covereth violence.
content_old: 6 Blessings are upon the head of a righteous man; but the mouth of the wicked covereth violence.

content: 7 The memory of the righteous man shall be blessed; but the name of the wicked shall rot.
content_old: 7 The memory of the righteous man shall be blessed; but the name of the wicked shall rot.

content: 8 The wise in heart receiveth commandments; but a prating fool shall fall.
content_old: 8 The wise in heart receiveth commandments; but a prating fool shall fall.

content: 9 He that walketh in integrity walketh securely; but he that perverteth his ways shall be known.
content_old: 9 He that walketh in integrity walketh securely; but he that perverteth his ways shall be known.

content: 10 He that winketh with the eye causeth grief, and a prating fool shall fall.
content_old: 10 He that winketh with the eye causeth grief, and a prating fool shall fall.

content: 11 The mouth of a righteous man is a fountain of life; but the mouth of the wicked covereth violence.
content_old: 11 The mouth of a righteous man is a fountain of life; but the mouth of the wicked covereth violence.

content: 12 Hatred stirreth up strifes; but love covereth all transgressions.
content_old: 12 Hatred stirreth up strifes; but love covereth all transgressions.

content: 13 In the lips of an intelligent man wisdom is found; but a rod is for the back of him that is void of understanding.
content_old: 13 In the lips of an intelligent man wisdom is found; but a rod is for the back of him that is void of understanding.

content: 14 The wise lay up knowledge; but the mouth of the fool is near destruction.
content_old: 14 The wise lay up knowledge; but the mouth of the fool is near destruction.

content: 15 The rich man’s wealth is his strong city; the destruction of the poor is their poverty.
content_old: 15 The rich man’s wealth is his strong city; the destruction of the poor is their poverty.

content: 16 The labour of a righteous man tendeth to life; the revenue of a wicked man, to sin.
content_old: 16 The labour of a righteous man tendeth to life; the revenue of a wicked man, to sin.

content: 17 Keeping instruction is the path to life; but he that forsaketh reproof goeth astray.
content_old: 17 Keeping instruction is the path to life; but he that forsaketh reproof goeth astray.

content: 18 He that covereth hatred hath lying lips, and he that sendeth forth a slander is a fool.
content_old: 18 He that covereth hatred hath lying lips, and he that sendeth forth a slander is a fool.

content: 19 In the multitude of words there wanteth not transgression; but he that restraineth his lips doeth wisely.
content_old: 19 In the multitude of words there wanteth not transgression; but he that restraineth his lips doeth wisely.

content: 20 The tongue of the righteous man is as choice silver; the heart of the wicked is little worth.
content_old: 20 The tongue of the righteous man is as choice silver; the heart of the wicked is little worth.

content: 21 The lips of a righteous man feed many; but fools die for want of understanding.
content_old: 21 The lips of a righteous man feed many; but fools die for want of understanding.

content: 22 The blessing of Jehovah, it maketh rich, and he addeth no sorrow to it.
content_old: 22 The blessing of Jehovah, it maketh rich, and he addeth no sorrow to it.

content: 23 It is as sport to a foolish man to do wickedness; but a man of understanding hath wisdom.
content_old: 23 It is as sport to a foolish man to do wickedness; but a man of understanding hath wisdom.

content: 24 The fear of a wicked man, it shall come upon him; but the desire of the righteous shall be granted.
content_old: 24 The fear of a wicked man, it shall come upon him; but the desire of the righteous shall be granted.

content: 25 As a whirlwind passeth, so is the wicked no more; but the righteous is an everlasting foundation.
content_old: 25 As a whirlwind passeth, so is the wicked no more; but the righteous is an everlasting foundation.

content: 26 As vinegar to the teeth, and as smoke to the eyes, so is the sluggard to them that send him.
content_old: 26 As vinegar to the teeth, and as smoke to the eyes, so is the sluggard to them that send him.

content: 27 The fear of Jehovah prolongeth days; but the years of the wicked shall be shortened.
content_old: 27 The fear of Jehovah prolongeth days; but the years of the wicked shall be shortened.

content: 28 The hope of the righteous is joy; but the expectation of the wicked shall perish.
content_old: 28 The hope of the righteous is joy; but the expectation of the wicked shall perish.

content: 29 The way of Jehovah is strength to the perfect man, but destruction to the workers of iniquity.
content_old: 29 The way of Jehovah is strength to the perfect man, but destruction to the workers of iniquity.

content: 30 The righteous man shall never be moved; but the wicked shall not inhabit the land.
content_old: 30 The righteous man shall never be moved; but the wicked shall not inhabit the land.

content: 31 The mouth of a righteous man putteth forth wisdom; but the froward tongue shall be cut out.
content_old: 31 The mouth of a righteous man putteth forth wisdom; but the froward tongue shall be cut out.

content: 1 A false balance is an abomination to Jehovah; but a just weight is his delight.
content_old: 1 A false balance is an abomination to Jehovah; but a just weight is his delight.

content: 2 When pride cometh, then cometh shame; but with the lowly is wisdom.
content_old: 2 When pride cometh, then cometh shame; but with the lowly is wisdom.

content: 3 The integrity of the upright guideth them; but the crookedness of the unfaithful destroyeth them.
content_old: 3 The integrity of the upright guideth them; but the crookedness of the unfaithful destroyeth them.

content: 4 Wealth profiteth not in the day of wrath; but righteousness delivereth from death.
content_old: 4 Wealth profiteth not in the day of wrath; but righteousness delivereth from death.

content: 5 The righteousness of the perfect maketh plain his way; but the wicked falleth by his own wickedness.
content_old: 5 The righteousness of the perfect maketh plain his way; but the wicked falleth by his own wickedness.

content: 6 The righteousness of the upright delivereth them; but the treacherous are taken in their own craving.
content_old: 6 The righteousness of the upright delivereth them; but the treacherous are taken in their own craving.

content: 7 When a wicked man dieth, his expectation shall perish; and the hope of evil men perisheth.
content_old: 7 When a wicked man dieth, his expectation shall perish; and the hope of evil men perisheth.

content: 8 The righteous is delivered out of trouble, and the wicked cometh in his stead.
content_old: 8 The righteous is delivered out of trouble, and the wicked cometh in his stead.

content: 9 With his mouth a hypocrite destroyeth his neighbour; but through knowledge are the righteous delivered.
content_old: 9 With his mouth a hypocrite destroyeth his neighbour; but through knowledge are the righteous delivered.

content: 10 When it goeth well with the righteous, the city rejoiceth; and when the wicked perish, there is shouting.
content_old: 10 When it goeth well with the righteous, the city rejoiceth; and when the wicked perish, there is shouting.

content: 11 By the blessing of the upright the city is exalted; but it is overthrown by the mouth of the wicked.
content_old: 11 By the blessing of the upright the city is exalted; but it is overthrown by the mouth of the wicked.

content: 12 He that despiseth his neighbour is void of heart; but a man of understanding holdeth his peace.
content_old: 12 He that despiseth his neighbour is void of heart; but a man of understanding holdeth his peace.

content: 13 He that goeth about talebearing revealeth secrets; but he that is of a faithful spirit concealeth the matter.
content_old: 13 He that goeth about talebearing revealeth secrets; but he that is of a faithful spirit concealeth the matter.

content: 14 Where no advice is, the people fall; but in the multitude of counsellors there is safety.
content_old: 14 Where no advice is, the people fall; but in the multitude of counsellors there is safety.

content: 15 It goeth ill with him that is surety for another; but he that hateth suretyship is secure.
content_old: 15 It goeth ill with him that is surety for another; but he that hateth suretyship is secure.

content: 16 A gracious woman retaineth honour; and the violent retain riches.
content_old: 16 A gracious woman retaineth honour; and the violent retain riches.

content: 17 The merciful man doeth good to his own soul; but the cruel troubleth his own flesh.
content_old: 17 The merciful man doeth good to his own soul; but the cruel troubleth his own flesh.

content: 18 The wicked worketh a deceitful work; but he that soweth righteousness hath a sure reward.
content_old: 18 The wicked worketh a deceitful work; but he that soweth righteousness hath a sure reward.

content: 19 As righteousness tendeth to life, so he that pursueth evil doeth it to his own death.
content_old: 19 As righteousness tendeth to life, so he that pursueth evil doeth it to his own death.

content: 20 The perverse in heart are abomination to Jehovah; but they that are perfect in their way are his delight.
content_old: 20 The perverse in heart are abomination to Jehovah; but they that are perfect in their way are his delight.

content: 21 Hand for hand! an evil man shall not be held innocent; but the seed of the righteous shall be delivered.
content_old: 21 Hand for hand! an evil man shall not be held innocent; but the seed of the righteous shall be delivered.

content: 22 A fair woman who is without discretion, is as a gold ring in a swine’s snout.
content_old: 22 A fair woman who is without discretion, is as a gold ring in a swine’s snout.

content: 23 The desire of the righteous is only good; the expectation of the wicked is wrath.
content_old: 23 The desire of the righteous is only good; the expectation of the wicked is wrath.

content: 24 There is that scattereth, and yet increaseth; and there is that withholdeth more than is right, but it tendeth only to want.
content_old: 24 There is that scattereth, and yet increaseth; and there is that withholdeth more than is right, but it tendeth only to want.

content: 25 The liberal soul shall be made fat, and he that watereth shall be watered also himself.
content_old: 25 The liberal soul shall be made fat, and he that watereth shall be watered also himself.

content: 26 He that withholdeth corn, the people curse him; but blessing shall be upon the head of him that selleth it.
content_old: 26 He that withholdeth corn, the people curse him; but blessing shall be upon the head of him that selleth it.

content: 27 He that is earnest after good seeketh favour; but he that searcheth for mischief, it shall come upon him.
content_old: 27 He that is earnest after good seeketh favour; but he that searcheth for mischief, it shall come upon him.

content: 28 He that trusteth in his riches shall fall; but the righteous shall flourish as a leaf.
content_old: 28 He that trusteth in his riches shall fall; but the righteous shall flourish as a leaf.

content: 29 He that troubleth his own house shall inherit wind; and the fool shall be servant to the wise of heart.
content_old: 29 He that troubleth his own house shall inherit wind; and the fool shall be servant to the wise of heart.

content: 30 The fruit of the righteous is a tree of life; and the wise winneth souls.

content: 1 Whoso loveth discipline loveth knowledge, but he that hateth reproof is brutish.

content: 2 A good man obtaineth favour of Jehovah; but a man of mischievous devices will he condemn.
content_old: 2 A good man obtaineth favour of Jehovah; but a man of mischievous devices will he condemn.

content: 3 A man shall not be established by wickedness; but the root of the righteous shall not be moved.
content_old: 3 A man shall not be established by wickedness; but the root of the righteous shall not be moved.

content: 4 A woman of worth is a crown to her husband; but she that maketh ashamed is as rottenness in his bones.

content: 8 A man is commended according to his wisdom; but he that is of a perverted heart shall be despised.

content: 16 The vexation of the fool is presently known; but a prudent man covereth shame.

content: 20 Deceit is in the heart of them that devise evil; but to the counsellors of peace is joy.

content: 21 There shall no evil happen to a righteous man; but the wicked shall be filled with mischief.

content: 22 Lying lips are an abomination to Jehovah; but they that deal truly are his delight.

content: 23 A prudent man concealeth knowledge; but the heart of the foolish proclaimeth folly.

content: 26 The righteous guideth his neighbour; but the way of the wicked misleadeth them.

content: 27 The slothful roasteth not what he took in hunting; but man’s precious substance is to the diligent.

content: 1 A wise son heareth his father’s instruction; but a scorner heareth not rebuke.

content: 2 A man shall eat good by the fruit of his mouth; but the soul of the treacherous, violence.

content: 4 A sluggard’s soul desireth and hath nothing; but the soul of the diligent shall be made fat.

content: 5 A righteous man hateth lying; but the wicked maketh himself odious and cometh to shame.

content: 9 The light of the righteous rejoiceth; but the lamp of the wicked shall be put out.

content: 10 By pride there only cometh contention; but with the well-advised is wisdom.

content: 11 Wealth gotten by vanity diminisheth; but he that gathereth by manual-labour shall increase it.

content: 12 Hope deferred maketh the heart sick; but the desire that cometh to pass is a tree of life.

content: 13 Whoso despiseth the word shall be held by it; but he that feareth the commandment shall be rewarded.

content: 14 The teaching of the wise man is a fountain of life, to turn away from the snares of death.

content: 15 Good understanding procureth favour; but the way of the treacherous is hard.

content: 16 Every prudent man acteth with knowledge; but the foolish layeth open his folly.

content: 17 A wicked messenger falleth into evil; but a faithful ambassador is health.

content: 19 The desire accomplished is sweet to the soul; but it is abomination to the foolish to depart from evil.

content: 20 He that walketh with wise men becometh wise; but a companion of the foolish will be depraved.

content: 21 Evil pursueth sinners; but to the righteous good shall be repaid.

content: 22 A good man leaveth an inheritance to his children’s children; but the wealth of the sinner is laid up for the righteous man.

content: 23 Much food is in the tillage of the poor; but there is that is lost for want of judgment.

content: 24 He that spareth his rod hateth his son; but he that loveth him chasteneth him betimes.

content: 1 The wisdom of women buildeth their house; but folly plucketh it down with her hands.

content: 6 A scorner seeketh wisdom, and there is none for him; but knowledge is easy unto the intelligent.

content: 1 Better is a dry morsel, and quietness therewith, than a house full of feasting with strife.
content_old: 1 Better is a dry morsel, and quietness therewith, than a house full of feasting with strife.

content: 2 A wise servant shall rule over a son that causeth shame, and shall have part in the inheritance among the brethren.
content_old: 2 A wise servant shall rule over a son that causeth shame, and shall have part in the inheritance among the brethren.

content: 3 The fining-pot is for silver, and the furnace for gold; but Jehovah trieth the hearts.
content_old: 3 The fining-pot is for silver, and the furnace for gold; but Jehovah trieth the hearts.

content: 4 The evil-doer giveth heed to iniquitous lips; the liar giveth ear to a mischievous tongue.
content_old: 4 The evil-doer giveth heed to iniquitous lips; the liar giveth ear to a mischievous tongue.

content: 5 Whoso mocketh a poor man reproacheth his Maker; he that is glad at calamity shall not be held innocent.
content_old: 5 Whoso mocketh a poor man reproacheth his Maker; he that is glad at calamity shall not be held innocent.

content: 6 Children’s children are the crown of old men; and the glory of children are their fathers.
content_old: 6 Children’s children are the crown of old men; and the glory of children are their fathers.

content: 7 Excellent speech becometh not a vile man; how much less do lying lips a noble!
content_old: 7 Excellent speech becometh not a vile man; how much less do lying lips a noble!

content: 8 A gift is a precious stone in the eyes of the possessor: whithersoever it turneth it prospereth.
content_old: 8 A gift is a precious stone in the eyes of the possessor: whithersoever it turneth it prospereth.

content: 9 He that covereth transgression seeketh love; but he that bringeth a matter up again separateth very friends.
content_old: 9 He that covereth transgression seeketh love; but he that bringeth a matter up again separateth very friends.

content: 10 A reproof entereth more deeply into him that hath understanding than a hundred stripes into a fool.
content_old: 10 A reproof entereth more deeply into him that hath understanding than a hundred stripes into a fool.

content: 11 An evil man seeketh only rebellion; but a cruel messenger shall be sent against him.
content_old: 11 An evil man seeketh only rebellion; but a cruel messenger shall be sent against him.

content: 12 Let a bear robbed of her whelps meet a man rather than a fool in his folly.
content_old: 12 Let a bear robbed of her whelps meet a man rather than a fool in his folly.

content: 13 Whoso rewardeth evil for good, evil shall not depart from his house.
content_old: 13 Whoso rewardeth evil for good, evil shall not depart from his house.

content: 14 The beginning of contention is as when one letteth out water; therefore leave off strife before it become vehement.
content_old: 14 The beginning of contention is as when one letteth out water; therefore leave off strife before it become vehement.

content: 15 He that justifieth the wicked, and he that condemneth the righteous, even they both are abomination to Jehovah.
content_old: 15 He that justifieth the wicked, and he that condemneth the righteous, even they both are abomination to Jehovah.

content: 16 To what purpose is there a price in the hand of a fool to get wisdom, seeing he hath no sense?
content_old: 16 To what purpose is there a price in the hand of a fool to get wisdom, seeing he hath no sense?

content: 17 The friend loveth at all times, and a brother is born for adversity.
content_old: 17 The friend loveth at all times, and a brother is born for adversity.

content: 18 A senseless man striketh hands, becoming surety for his neighbour.
content_old: 18 A senseless man striketh hands, becoming surety for his neighbour.

content: 19 He loveth transgression that loveth a quarrel; he that maketh high his gate seeketh destruction.
content_old: 19 He loveth transgression that loveth a quarrel; he that maketh high his gate seeketh destruction.

content: 20 He that hath a perverse heart findeth no good; and he that shifteth about with his tongue falleth into evil.
content_old: 20 He that hath a perverse heart findeth no good; and he that shifteth about with his tongue falleth into evil.

content: 21 He that begetteth a fool doeth it to his sorrow, and the father of a vile man hath no joy.
content_old: 21 He that begetteth a fool doeth it to his sorrow, and the father of a vile man hath no joy.

content: 22 A joyful heart promoteth healing; but a broken spirit drieth up the bones.
content_old: 22 A joyful heart promoteth healing; but a broken spirit drieth up the bones.

content: 23 A wicked man taketh a gift out of the bosom, to pervert the paths of judgment.
content_old: 23 A wicked man taketh a gift out of the bosom, to pervert the paths of judgment.

content: 24 Wisdom is before him that hath understanding; but the eyes of a fool are in the ends of the earth.
content_old: 24 Wisdom is before him that hath understanding; but the eyes of a fool are in the ends of the earth.

content: 25 A foolish son is a grief to his father, and bitterness to her that bore him.
content_old: 25 A foolish son is a grief to his father, and bitterness to her that bore him.

content: 26 To punish a righteous man is not good, nor to strike nobles because of their uprightness.
content_old: 26 To punish a righteous man is not good, nor to strike nobles because of their uprightness.

content: 27 He that hath knowledge spareth his words; and a man of understanding is of a cool spirit.
content_old: 27 He that hath knowledge spareth his words; and a man of understanding is of a cool spirit.

content: 1 He that separateth himself seeketh his pleasure, he is vehement against all sound wisdom.
content_old: 1 He that separateth himself seeketh his pleasure, he is vehement against all sound wisdom.

content: 2 A fool hath no delight in understanding, but only that his heart may reveal itself.
content_old: 2 A fool hath no delight in understanding, but only that his heart may reveal itself.

content: 3 When the wicked cometh, there cometh also contempt, and with ignominy reproach.
content_old: 3 When the wicked cometh, there cometh also contempt, and with ignominy reproach.

content: 4 The words of a man’s mouth are deep waters, and the fountain of wisdom is a gushing brook.
content_old: 4 The words of a man’s mouth are deep waters, and the fountain of wisdom is a gushing brook.

content: 5 It is not good to accept the person of the wicked, to wrong the righteous in judgment.
content_old: 5 It is not good to accept the person of the wicked, to wrong the righteous in judgment.

content: 6 A fool’s lips enter into contention, and his mouth calleth for stripes.
content_old: 6 A fool’s lips enter into contention, and his mouth calleth for stripes.

content: 7 A fool’s mouth is destruction to him, and his lips are a snare to his soul.
content_old: 7 A fool’s mouth is destruction to him, and his lips are a snare to his soul.

content: 8 The words of a talebearer are as dainty morsels, and they go down into the innermost parts of the belly.
content_old: 8 The words of a talebearer are as dainty morsels, and they go down into the innermost parts of the belly.

content: 9 He also who is indolent in his work is brother of the destroyer.
content_old: 9 He also who is indolent in his work is brother of the destroyer.

content: 10 The name of Jehovah is a strong tower: the righteous runneth into it, and is safe.
content_old: 10 The name of Jehovah is a strong tower: the righteous runneth into it, and is safe.

content: 11 The rich man’s wealth is his strong city, and as a high wall in his own imagination.
content_old: 11 The rich man’s wealth is his strong city, and as a high wall in his own imagination.

content: 12 Before destruction the heart of man is haughty; and before honour goeth humility.
content_old: 12 Before destruction the heart of man is haughty; and before honour goeth humility.

content: 13 He that giveth answer before he heareth, it is folly and shame unto him.
content_old: 13 He that giveth answer before he heareth, it is folly and shame unto him.

content: 14 The spirit of a man sustaineth his infirmity; but a broken spirit who can bear?
content_old: 14 The spirit of a man sustaineth his infirmity; but a broken spirit who can bear?

content: 15 The heart of an intelligent man getteth knowledge, and the ear of the wise seeketh knowledge.
content_old: 15 The heart of an intelligent man getteth knowledge, and the ear of the wise seeketh knowledge.

content: 16 A man’s gift maketh room for him, and bringeth him before great men.
content_old: 16 A man’s gift maketh room for him, and bringeth him before great men.

content: 17 He that is first in his own cause seemeth just; but his neighbour cometh and searcheth him.
content_old: 17 He that is first in his own cause seemeth just; but his neighbour cometh and searcheth him.

content: 18 The lot causeth contentions to cease, and parteth between the mighty.
content_old: 18 The lot causeth contentions to cease, and parteth between the mighty.

content: 19 A brother offended is harder to be won than a strong city; and contentions are as the bars of a palace.
content_old: 19 A brother offended is harder to be won than a strong city; and contentions are as the bars of a palace.

content: 20 A man’s belly is satisfied with the fruit of his mouth; with the increase of his lips is he satisfied.
content_old: 20 A man’s belly is satisfied with the fruit of his mouth; with the increase of his lips is he satisfied.

content: 21 Death and life are in the power of the tongue, and they that love it shall eat the fruit thereof.
content_old: 21 Death and life are in the power of the tongue, and they that love it shall eat the fruit thereof.

content: 22 Whoso hath found a wife hath found a good thing, and hath obtained favour from Jehovah.
content_old: 22 Whoso hath found a wife hath found a good thing, and hath obtained favour from Jehovah.

content: 23 He that is poor speaketh with supplications, but the rich answereth roughly.
content_old: 23 He that is poor speaketh with supplications, but the rich answereth roughly.

content: 1 Better is a poor man that walketh in his integrity, than he that is perverse in his lips, and is a fool.
content_old: 1 Better is a poor man that walketh in his integrity, than he that is perverse in his lips, and is a fool.

content: 2 Also that a person be without knowledge is not good; and he that hasteth with his feet maketh false steps.
content_old: 2 Also that a person be without knowledge is not good; and he that hasteth with his feet maketh false steps.

content: 3 The folly of man distorteth his way, and his heart is irritated against Jehovah.
content_old: 3 The folly of man distorteth his way, and his heart is irritated against Jehovah.

content: 4 Wealth addeth many friends; but the poor is separated from his friend.
content_old: 4 Wealth addeth many friends; but the poor is separated from his friend.

content: 5 A false witness shall not be held innocent, and he that uttereth lies shall not escape.
content_old: 5 A false witness shall not be held innocent, and he that uttereth lies shall not escape.

content: 6 Many court the favour of a noble; and every one is friend to a man that giveth.
content_old: 6 Many court the favour of a noble; and every one is friend to a man that giveth.

content: 7 All the brethren of a poor man hate him; how much more do his friends go far from him: he pursueth them with words, —they are not to be found.
content_old: 7 All the brethren of a poor man hate him; how much more do his friends go far from him: he pursueth them with words, —they are not to be found.

content: 8 He that getteth sense loveth his own soul; he that keepeth understanding shall find good.
content_old: 8 He that getteth sense loveth his own soul; he that keepeth understanding shall find good.

content: 9 A false witness shall not be held innocent, and he that uttereth lies shall perish.
content_old: 9 A false witness shall not be held innocent, and he that uttereth lies shall perish.

content: 10 Good living beseemeth not a fool; how much less for a servant to have rule over princes.
content_old: 10 Good living beseemeth not a fool; how much less for a servant to have rule over princes.

content: 11 The discretion of a man maketh him slow to anger, and it is his glory to pass over a transgression.
content_old: 11 The discretion of a man maketh him slow to anger, and it is his glory to pass over a transgression.

content: 12 The king’s displeasure is as the roaring of a lion; but his favour is as dew upon the grass.
content_old: 12 The king’s displeasure is as the roaring of a lion; but his favour is as dew upon the grass.

content: 13 A foolish son is the calamity of his father; and the contentions of a wife are a continual dropping.
content_old: 13 A foolish son is the calamity of his father; and the contentions of a wife are a continual dropping.

content: 14 House and wealth are an inheritance from fathers; but a prudent wife is from Jehovah.
content_old: 14 House and wealth are an inheritance from fathers; but a prudent wife is from Jehovah.

content: 15 Slothfulness casteth into a deep sleep, and the idle soul shall suffer hunger.
content_old: 15 Slothfulness casteth into a deep sleep, and the idle soul shall suffer hunger.

content: 16 He that keepeth the commandment keepeth his soul; he that is careless of his ways shall die.
content_old: 16 He that keepeth the commandment keepeth his soul; he that is careless of his ways shall die.

content: 17 He that is gracious to the poor lendeth unto Jehovah; and what he hath bestowed will he repay unto him.
content_old: 17 He that is gracious to the poor lendeth unto Jehovah; and what he hath bestowed will he repay unto him.

content: 18 Chasten thy son, seeing there is hope; but set not thy soul upon killing him.
content_old: 18 Chasten thy son, seeing there is hope; but set not thy soul upon killing him.

content: 19 A man of great wrath shall suffer punishment; for if thou deliver him, yet thou must do it again.
content_old: 19 A man of great wrath shall suffer punishment; for if thou deliver him, yet thou must do it again.

content: 20 Hear counsel, and receive instruction, that thou mayest be wise in thy latter end.
content_old: 20 Hear counsel, and receive instruction, that thou mayest be wise in thy latter end.

content: 21 Many are the thoughts in a man’s heart, but the counsel of Jehovah, that doth stand.
content_old: 21 Many are the thoughts in a man’s heart, but the counsel of Jehovah, that doth stand.

content: 22 The charm of a man is his kindness; and a poor man is better than a liar.
content_old: 22 The charm of a man is his kindness; and a poor man is better than a liar.

content: 23 The fear of Jehovah tendeth to life, and he that hath it shall rest satisfied without being visited with evil.
content_old: 23 The fear of Jehovah tendeth to life, and he that hath it shall rest satisfied without being visited with evil.

content: 24 A sluggard burieth his hand in the dish, and will not even bring it to his mouth again.
content_old: 24 A sluggard burieth his hand in the dish, and will not even bring it to his mouth again.

content: 25 Smite a scorner, and the simple will beware; reprove the intelligent, and he will understand knowledge.
content_old: 25 Smite a scorner, and the simple will beware; reprove the intelligent, and he will understand knowledge.

content: 26 He that ruineth his father and chaseth away his mother is a son that causeth shame and bringeth reproach.
content_old: 26 He that ruineth his father and chaseth away his mother is a son that causeth shame and bringeth reproach.

content: 27 Cease, my son, to hear the instruction which causeth to stray from the words of knowledge.
content_old: 27 Cease, my son, to hear the instruction which causeth to stray from the words of knowledge.

content: 28 A witness of Belial scorneth judgment, and the mouth of the wicked swalloweth down iniquity.
content_old: 28 A witness of Belial scorneth judgment, and the mouth of the wicked swalloweth down iniquity.

content: 1 Wine is a scorner, strong drink is raging; and whoso erreth thereby is not wise.
content_old: 1 Wine is a scorner, strong drink is raging; and whoso erreth thereby is not wise.

content: 2 The terror of a king is as the roaring of a lion: he that provoketh him to anger sinneth against his own soul.
content_old: 2 The terror of a king is as the roaring of a lion: he that provoketh him to anger sinneth against his own soul.

content: 3 It is an honour for a man to cease from strife; but every fool rusheth into it.
content_old: 3 It is an honour for a man to cease from strife; but every fool rusheth into it.

content: 4 The sluggard will not plough by reason of the winter; he shall beg in harvest, and have nothing.
content_old: 4 The sluggard will not plough by reason of the winter; he shall beg in harvest, and have nothing.

content: 5 Counsel in the heart of man is deep water, and a man of understanding draweth it out.
content_old: 5 Counsel in the heart of man is deep water, and a man of understanding draweth it out.

content: 6 Most men will proclaim every one his own kindness; but a faithful man who shall find?
content_old: 6 Most men will proclaim every one his own kindness; but a faithful man who shall find?

content: 7 The righteous walketh in his integrity: blessed are his children after him!
content_old: 7 The righteous walketh in his integrity: blessed are his children after him!

content: 8 A king sitting on the throne of judgment scattereth away all evil with his eyes.
content_old: 8 A king sitting on the throne of judgment scattereth away all evil with his eyes.
