content: 9 Who can say, I have made my heart clean, I am pure from my sin?
content_old: 9 Who can say, I have made my heart clean, I am pure from my sin?

content: 10 Divers weights, divers measures, even both of them are abomination to Jehovah.
content_old: 10 Divers weights, divers measures, even both of them are abomination to Jehovah.

content: 11 Even a child is known by his doings, whether his work be pure, and whether it be right.
content_old: 11 Even a child is known by his doings, whether his work be pure, and whether it be right.

content: 12 The hearing ear, and the seeing eye, Jehovah hath made even both of them.
content_old: 12 The hearing ear, and the seeing eye, Jehovah hath made even both of them.

content: 13 Love not sleep, lest thou come to poverty; open thine eyes, and thou shalt be satisfied with bread.
content_old: 13 Love not sleep, lest thou come to poverty; open thine eyes, and thou shalt be satisfied with bread.

content: 14 Bad! bad! saith the buyer; but when he is gone his way, then he boasteth.
content_old: 14 Bad! bad! saith the buyer; but when he is gone his way, then he boasteth.

content: 15 There is gold, and a multitude of rubies; but the lips of knowledge are a precious Jewel.
content_old: 15 There is gold, and a multitude of rubies; but the lips of knowledge are a precious Jewel.

content: 16 Take his garment that is become surety for another, and hold him in pledge for strangers.
content_old: 16 Take his garment that is become surety for another, and hold him in pledge for strangers.

content: 17 Bread of falsehood is sweet to a man, but afterwards his mouth shall be filled with gravel.
content_old: 17 Bread of falsehood is sweet to a man, but afterwards his mouth shall be filled with gravel.

content: 18 Plans are established by counsel; and with good advice make war.
content_old: 18 Plans are established by counsel; and with good advice make war.

content: 19 He that goeth about talebearing revealeth secrets; therefore meddle not with him that openeth his lips.
content_old: 19 He that goeth about talebearing revealeth secrets; therefore meddle not with him that openeth his lips.

content: 20 Whoso curseth his father or his mother, his lamp shall be put out in the blackest darkness.
content_old: 20 Whoso curseth his father or his mother, his lamp shall be put out in the blackest darkness.

content: 21 An inheritance obtained hastily at the beginning will not be blessed in the end.
content_old: 21 An inheritance obtained hastily at the beginning will not be blessed in the end.

content: 22 Say not, I will recompense evil: wait on Jehovah, and he shall save thee.
content_old: 22 Say not, I will recompense evil: wait on Jehovah, and he shall save thee.

content: 23 Divers weights are an abomination unto Jehovah; and a false balance is not good.
content_old: 23 Divers weights are an abomination unto Jehovah; and a false balance is not good.

content: 24 The steps of a man are from Jehovah; and how can a man understand his own way?
content_old: 24 The steps of a man are from Jehovah; and how can a man understand his own way?

content: 25 It is a snare to a man rashly to say, It is hallowed, and after vows to make inquiry.
content_old: 25 It is a snare to a man rashly to say, It is hallowed, and after vows to make inquiry.

content: 26 A wise king scattereth the wicked, and bringeth the wheel over them.
content_old: 26 A wise king scattereth the wicked, and bringeth the wheel over them.

content: 27 Man’s spirit is the lamp of Jehovah, searching all the inner parts of the belly.
content_old: 27 Man’s spirit is the lamp of Jehovah, searching all the inner parts of the belly.

content: 28 Mercy and truth preserve the king; and he upholdeth his throne by mercy.
content_old: 28 Mercy and truth preserve the king; and he upholdeth his throne by mercy.

content: 29 The glory of young men is their strength; and the beauty of old men is the grey head.
content_old: 29 The glory of young men is their strength; and the beauty of old men is the grey head.

content: 1 The king’s heart in the hand of Jehovah is as brooks of water: he turneth it whithersoever he will.
content_old: 1 The king’s heart in the hand of Jehovah is as brooks of water: he turneth it whithersoever he will.

content: 2 Every way of a man is right in his own eyes; but Jehovah weigheth the hearts.
content_old: 2 Every way of a man is right in his own eyes; but Jehovah weigheth the hearts.

content: 3 To exercise justice and judgment is more acceptable to Jehovah than sacrifice.
content_old: 3 To exercise justice and judgment is more acceptable to Jehovah than sacrifice.

content: 4 Lofty eyes, and a proud heart, the lamp of the wicked, is sin.
content_old: 4 Lofty eyes, and a proud heart, the lamp of the wicked, is sin.

content: 5 The thoughts of the diligent tend only to plenteousness; but of every one that is hasty, only to want.
content_old: 5 The thoughts of the diligent tend only to plenteousness; but of every one that is hasty, only to want.

content: 6 The getting of treasures by a lying tongue is a fleeting breath of them that seek death.
content_old: 6 The getting of treasures by a lying tongue is a fleeting breath of them that seek death.

content: 7 The devastation of the wicked sweepeth them away, because they refuse to do what is right.
content_old: 7 The devastation of the wicked sweepeth them away, because they refuse to do what is right.

content: 8 Very crooked is the way of a guilty man; but as for the pure, his work is upright.
content_old: 8 Very crooked is the way of a guilty man; but as for the pure, his work is upright.

content: 9 It is better to dwell in a corner of the housetop, than with a contentious woman, and a house in common.
content_old: 9 It is better to dwell in a corner of the housetop, than with a contentious woman, and a house in common.

content: 10 The soul of the wicked desireth evil: his neighbour findeth no favour in his eyes.
content_old: 10 The soul of the wicked desireth evil: his neighbour findeth no favour in his eyes.

content: 11 When the scorner is punished, the simple becometh wise; and when the wise is instructed, he receiveth knowledge.
content_old: 11 When the scorner is punished, the simple becometh wise; and when the wise is instructed, he receiveth knowledge.

content: 12 One that is righteous wisely considereth the house of the wicked: he overthroweth the wicked to their ruin.
content_old: 12 One that is righteous wisely considereth the house of the wicked: he overthroweth the wicked to their ruin.

content: 13 Whoso stoppeth his ears at the cry of the poor, he also himself shall cry, and shall not be heard.
content_old: 13 Whoso stoppeth his ears at the cry of the poor, he also himself shall cry, and shall not be heard.

content: 14 A gift in secret pacifieth anger; and a present in the bosom, vehement fury.
content_old: 14 A gift in secret pacifieth anger; and a present in the bosom, vehement fury.

content: 15 It is joy to a righteous man to do what is right; but it is ruin for the workers of iniquity.
content_old: 15 It is joy to a righteous man to do what is right; but it is ruin for the workers of iniquity.

content: 16 The man that wandereth out of the way of wisdom shall abide in the congregation of the dead.
content_old: 16 The man that wandereth out of the way of wisdom shall abide in the congregation of the dead.

content: 17 He that loveth mirth shall be a poor man; he that loveth wine and oil shall not be rich.
content_old: 17 He that loveth mirth shall be a poor man; he that loveth wine and oil shall not be rich.

content: 18 The wicked is a ransom for the righteous, and a treacherous man in the stead of the upright.
content_old: 18 The wicked is a ransom for the righteous, and a treacherous man in the stead of the upright.

content: 19 It is better to dwell in a desert land. than with a contentious and irritable woman.
content_old: 19 It is better to dwell in a desert land. than with a contentious and irritable woman.

content: 20 There is costly store and oil in the dwelling of a wise man; but a foolish man swalloweth it up.
content_old: 20 There is costly store and oil in the dwelling of a wise man; but a foolish man swalloweth it up.

content: 21 He that followeth after righteousness and mercy findeth life, righteousness, and honour.
content_old: 21 He that followeth after righteousness and mercy findeth life, righteousness, and honour.

content: 22 A wise man scaleth the city of the mighty, and casteth down the strength of the confidence thereof.
content_old: 22 A wise man scaleth the city of the mighty, and casteth down the strength of the confidence thereof.

content: 23 Whoso keepeth his mouth and his tongue keepeth his soul from troubles.
content_old: 23 Whoso keepeth his mouth and his tongue keepeth his soul from troubles.

content: 24 Proud, arrogant, scorner is his name who dealeth in proud wrath.
content_old: 24 Proud, arrogant, scorner is his name who dealeth in proud wrath.

content: 25 The desire of the sluggard killeth him; for his hands refuse to work:
content_old: 25 The desire of the sluggard killeth him; for his hands refuse to work:

content: 26 He coveteth greedily all the day long; but the righteous giveth and spareth not.
content_old: 26 He coveteth greedily all the day long; but the righteous giveth and spareth not.

content: 27 The sacrifice of the wicked is abomination: how much more when they bring it with a wicked purpose!
content_old: 27 The sacrifice of the wicked is abomination: how much more when they bring it with a wicked purpose!

content: 28 A lying witness shall perish; and a man that heareth shall speak constantly.
content_old: 28 A lying witness shall perish; and a man that heareth shall speak constantly.

content: 29 A wicked man hardeneth his face; but as for the upright, he establisheth his way.
content_old: 29 A wicked man hardeneth his face; but as for the upright, he establisheth his way.

content: 30 There is no wisdom, nor understanding, nor counsel against Jehovah.
content_old: 30 There is no wisdom, nor understanding, nor counsel against Jehovah.

content: 1 A good name is rather to be chosen than great riches; loving favour rather than silver and gold.
content_old: 1 A good name is rather to be chosen than great riches; loving favour rather than silver and gold.

content: 2 The rich and poor meet together; Jehovah is the maker of them all.
content_old: 2 The rich and poor meet together; Jehovah is the maker of them all.

content: 3 A prudent man seeth the evil, and hideth himself; but the simple pass on, and are punished.
content_old: 3 A prudent man seeth the evil, and hideth himself; but the simple pass on, and are punished.

content: 4 The reward of humility and the fear of Jehovah is riches, and honour, and life.
content_old: 4 The reward of humility and the fear of Jehovah is riches, and honour, and life.

content: 5 Thorns and snares are in the way of the perverse: he that keepeth his soul holdeth himself far from them.
content_old: 5 Thorns and snares are in the way of the perverse: he that keepeth his soul holdeth himself far from them.

content: 6 Train up the child according to the tenor of his way, and when he is old he will not depart from it.
content_old: 6 Train up the child according to the tenor of his way, and when he is old he will not depart from it.

content: 7 The rich ruleth over the poor; and the borrower is servant to the lender.
content_old: 7 The rich ruleth over the poor; and the borrower is servant to the lender.

content: 8 He that soweth unrighteousness shall reap iniquity, and the rod of his wrath shall have an end.
content_old: 8 He that soweth unrighteousness shall reap iniquity, and the rod of his wrath shall have an end.

content: 9 He that hath a bountiful eye shall be blessed, for he giveth of his bread to the poor.
content_old: 9 He that hath a bountiful eye shall be blessed, for he giveth of his bread to the poor.

content: 10 Cast out the scorner, and contention will depart, and strife and ignominy shall cease.
content_old: 10 Cast out the scorner, and contention will depart, and strife and ignominy shall cease.

content: 11 He that loveth pureness of heart, upon whose lips is grace, the king is his friend.
content_old: 11 He that loveth pureness of heart, upon whose lips is grace, the king is his friend.

content: 12 The eyes of Jehovah preserve knowledge; but he overthroweth the words of the unfaithful.
content_old: 12 The eyes of Jehovah preserve knowledge; but he overthroweth the words of the unfaithful.

content: 13 The sluggard saith, There is a lion without, I shall be killed in the streets!
content_old: 13 The sluggard saith, There is a lion without, I shall be killed in the streets!

content: 14 The mouth of strange women is a deep ditch: he with whom Jehovah is displeased shall fall therein.
content_old: 14 The mouth of strange women is a deep ditch: he with whom Jehovah is displeased shall fall therein.

content: 15 Folly is bound in the heart of a child; the rod of correction shall drive it far from him.
content_old: 15 Folly is bound in the heart of a child; the rod of correction shall drive it far from him.

content: 16 He that oppresseth the poor, it is to enrich him; he that giveth to the rich, bringeth only to want.
content_old: 16 He that oppresseth the poor, it is to enrich him; he that giveth to the rich, bringeth only to want.

content: 17 Incline thine ear, and hear the words of the wise, and apply thy heart unto my knowledge.
content_old: 17 Incline thine ear, and hear the words of the wise, and apply thy heart unto my knowledge.

content: 18 For it is a pleasant thing if thou keep them within thee: they shall be together fitted on thy lips.
content_old: 18 For it is a pleasant thing if thou keep them within thee: they shall be together fitted on thy lips.

content: 19 That thy confidence may be in Jehovah, I have made them known to thee this day, even to thee.
content_old: 19 That thy confidence may be in Jehovah, I have made them known to thee this day, even to thee.

content: 20 Have not I written to thee excellent things, in counsels and knowledge,
content_old: 20 Have not I written to thee excellent things, in counsels and knowledge,

content: 21 that I might make thee know the certainty of the words of truth; that thou mightest carry back words of truth to them that send thee?
content_old: 21 that I might make thee know the certainty of the words of truth; that thou mightest carry back words of truth to them that send thee?

content: 22 Rob not the poor, because he is poor, neither oppress the afflicted in the gate;
content_old: 22 Rob not the poor, because he is poor, neither oppress the afflicted in the gate;

content: 23 for Jehovah will plead their cause, and despoil the soul of those that despoil them.
content_old: 23 for Jehovah will plead their cause, and despoil the soul of those that despoil them.

content: 24 Make no friendship with an angry man, and go not with a furious man;
content_old: 24 Make no friendship with an angry man, and go not with a furious man;

content: 25 lest thou learn his paths, and get a snare to thy soul.
content_old: 25 lest thou learn his paths, and get a snare to thy soul.

content: 26 Be not of them that strike hands, of them that are sureties for debts:
content_old: 26 Be not of them that strike hands, of them that are sureties for debts:

content: 27 if thou hast nothing to pay, why should he take away thy bed from under thee?
content_old: 27 if thou hast nothing to pay, why should he take away thy bed from under thee?

content: 28 Remove not the ancient landmark which thy fathers have set.
content_old: 28 Remove not the ancient landmark which thy fathers have set.

content: 1 When thou sittest to eat with a ruler, consider well who is before thee;
content_old: 1 When thou sittest to eat with a ruler, consider well who is before thee;

content: 2 and put a knife to thy throat, if thou be a man given to appetite.
content_old: 2 and put a knife to thy throat, if thou be a man given to appetite.

content: 3 Be not desirous of his dainties; for they are deceitful food.
content_old: 3 Be not desirous of his dainties; for they are deceitful food.

content: 4 Weary not thyself to become rich; cease from thine own intelligence:
content_old: 4 Weary not thyself to become rich; cease from thine own intelligence:

content: 5 wilt thou set thine eyes upon it, it is gone; for indeed it maketh itself wings and it flieth away as an eagle towards the heavens.
content_old: 5 wilt thou set thine eyes upon it, it is gone; for indeed it maketh itself wings and it flieth away as an eagle towards the heavens.

content: 6 Eat thou not the food of him that hath an evil eye, neither desire thou his dainties.
content_old: 6 Eat thou not the food of him that hath an evil eye, neither desire thou his dainties.

content: 7 For as he thinketh in his soul, so is he. Eat and drink! will he say unto thee; but his heart is not with thee.
content_old: 7 For as he thinketh in his soul, so is he. Eat and drink! will he say unto thee; but his heart is not with thee.

content: 8 Thy morsel which thou hast eaten must thou vomit up, and thou wilt have wasted thy sweet words.
content_old: 8 Thy morsel which thou hast eaten must thou vomit up, and thou wilt have wasted thy sweet words.

content: 9 Speak not in the ears of a foolish man, for he will despise the wisdom of thy words.
content_old: 9 Speak not in the ears of a foolish man, for he will despise the wisdom of thy words.

content: 10 Remove not the ancient landmark; and enter not into the fields of the fatherless:
content_old: 10 Remove not the ancient landmark; and enter not into the fields of the fatherless:

content: 11 for their redeemer is mighty; he will plead their cause against thee.
content_old: 11 for their redeemer is mighty; he will plead their cause against thee.

content: 12 Apply thy heart unto instruction, and thine ears to the words of knowledge.
content_old: 12 Apply thy heart unto instruction, and thine ears to the words of knowledge.

content: 13 Withhold not correction from the child; for if thou beatest him with the rod, he shall not die:
content_old: 13 Withhold not correction from the child; for if thou beatest him with the rod, he shall not die:

content: 14 thou shalt beat him with the rod, and shalt deliver his soul from Sheol.
content_old: 14 thou shalt beat him with the rod, and shalt deliver his soul from Sheol.

content: 15 My son, if thy heart be wise, my heart shall rejoice, even mine;
content_old: 15 My son, if thy heart be wise, my heart shall rejoice, even mine;

content: 16 and my reins shall exult, when thy lips speak right things.
content_old: 16 and my reins shall exult, when thy lips speak right things.

content: 17 Let not thy heart envy sinners, but be thou in the fear of Jehovah all the day;
content_old: 17 Let not thy heart envy sinners, but be thou in the fear of Jehovah all the day;

content: 18 for surely there is a result, and thine expectation shall not be cut off.
content_old: 18 for surely there is a result, and thine expectation shall not be cut off.

content: 19 Thou, my son, hear and be wise, and direct thy heart in the way.
content_old: 19 Thou, my son, hear and be wise, and direct thy heart in the way.

content: 20 Be not among winebibbers, among riotous eaters of flesh.
content_old: 20 Be not among winebibbers, among riotous eaters of flesh.

content: 21 For the drunkard and the glutton shall come to poverty; and drowsiness clotheth with rags.
content_old: 21 For the drunkard and the glutton shall come to poverty; and drowsiness clotheth with rags.

content: 22 Hearken unto thy father that begat thee, and despise not thy mother when she is old.
content_old: 22 Hearken unto thy father that begat thee, and despise not thy mother when she is old.

content: 23 Buy the truth, and sell it not; wisdom, and instruction, and intelligence.
content_old: 23 Buy the truth, and sell it not; wisdom, and instruction, and intelligence.

content: 24 The father of a righteous man shall greatly rejoice, and he that begetteth a wise son shall have joy of him:
content_old: 24 The father of a righteous man shall greatly rejoice, and he that begetteth a wise son shall have joy of him:

content: 25 let thy father and thy mother have joy, and let her that bore thee rejoice.
content_old: 25 let thy father and thy mother have joy, and let her that bore thee rejoice.

content: 26 My son, give me thy heart, and let thine eyes observe my ways.
content_old: 26 My son, give me thy heart, and let thine eyes observe my ways.

content: 27 For a whore is a deep ditch; and a strange woman is a narrow pit.
content_old: 27 For a whore is a deep ditch; and a strange woman is a narrow pit.

content: 28 She also lieth in wait as a robber, and increaseth the treacherous among men.
content_old: 28 She also lieth in wait as a robber, and increaseth the treacherous among men.

content: 29 Who hath woe? Who hath sorrow? Who contentions? Who complaining? Who wounds without cause? Who redness of eyes?
content_old: 29 Who hath woe? Who hath sorrow? Who contentions? Who complaining? Who wounds without cause? Who redness of eyes?

content: 30 —They that tarry long at the wine; they that go to try mixed wine.
content_old: 30 —They that tarry long at the wine; they that go to try mixed wine.

content: 31 Look not upon the wine when it is red, when it sparkleth in the cup, and goeth down smoothly:
content_old: 31 Look not upon the wine when it is red, when it sparkleth in the cup, and goeth down smoothly:

content: 32 at the last it biteth like a serpent, and stingeth like an adder.
content_old: 32 at the last it biteth like a serpent, and stingeth like an adder.

content: 33 Thine eyes shall behold strange women, and thy heart shall speak froward things;
content_old: 33 Thine eyes shall behold strange women, and thy heart shall speak froward things;

content: 34 and thou shalt be as he that lieth down in the midst of the sea, and as he that lieth down upon the top of a mast:
content_old: 34 and thou shalt be as he that lieth down in the midst of the sea, and as he that lieth down upon the top of a mast:

content: 1 Be not thou envious of evil men, neither desire to be with them;
content_old: 1 Be not thou envious of evil men, neither desire to be with them;

content: 2 for their heart studieth destruction, and their lips talk of mischief.
content_old: 2 for their heart studieth destruction, and their lips talk of mischief.

content: 3 Through wisdom is a house built, and by understanding it is established;
content_old: 3 Through wisdom is a house built, and by understanding it is established;

content: 4 and by knowledge are the chambers filled with all precious and pleasant substance.
content_old: 4 and by knowledge are the chambers filled with all precious and pleasant substance.

content: 5 A wise man is strong, and a man of knowledge increaseth strength.
content_old: 5 A wise man is strong, and a man of knowledge increaseth strength.

content: 6 For with good advice shalt thou make thy war; and in the multitude of counsellors there is safety.
content_old: 6 For with good advice shalt thou make thy war; and in the multitude of counsellors there is safety.

content: 7 Wisdom is too high for a fool: he will not open his mouth in the gate.
content_old: 7 Wisdom is too high for a fool: he will not open his mouth in the gate.

content: 8 He that deviseth to do evil shall be called a master of intrigues.
content_old: 8 He that deviseth to do evil shall be called a master of intrigues.

content: 9 The purpose of folly is sin, and the scorner is an abomination to men.
content_old: 9 The purpose of folly is sin, and the scorner is an abomination to men.

content: 10 If thou losest courage in the day of trouble, thy strength is small.
content_old: 10 If thou losest courage in the day of trouble, thy strength is small.

content: 11 Deliver them that are taken forth unto death, and withdraw not from them that stagger to slaughter.
content_old: 11 Deliver them that are taken forth unto death, and withdraw not from them that stagger to slaughter.

content: 12 If thou sayest, Behold, we knew it not, will not he that weigheth the hearts consider it? And he that preserveth thy soul, he knoweth it; and he rendereth to man according to his work.
content_old: 12 If thou sayest, Behold, we knew it not, will not he that weigheth the hearts consider it? And he that preserveth thy soul, he knoweth it; and he rendereth to man according to his work.

content: 13 Eat honey, my son, for it is good; and a honeycomb is sweet to thy taste:
content_old: 13 Eat honey, my son, for it is good; and a honeycomb is sweet to thy taste:

content: 14 so consider wisdom for thy soul; if thou hast found it, there shall be a result, and thine expectation shall not be cut off.
content_old: 14 so consider wisdom for thy soul; if thou hast found it, there shall be a result, and thine expectation shall not be cut off.

content: 15 Lay not wait, O wicked man, against the dwelling of the righteous; lay not waste his resting-place.
content_old: 15 Lay not wait, O wicked man, against the dwelling of the righteous; lay not waste his resting-place.

content: 16 For the righteous falleth seven times, and riseth up again; but the wicked stumble into disaster.
content_old: 16 For the righteous falleth seven times, and riseth up again; but the wicked stumble into disaster.

content: 17 Rejoice not when thine enemy falleth, and let not thy heart be glad when he stumbleth;
content_old: 17 Rejoice not when thine enemy falleth, and let not thy heart be glad when he stumbleth;

content: 18 lest Jehovah see it, and it be evil in his sight, and he turn away his anger from him.
content_old: 18 lest Jehovah see it, and it be evil in his sight, and he turn away his anger from him.

content: 19 Fret not thyself because of evil-doers, and be not envious of the wicked:
content_old: 19 Fret not thyself because of evil-doers, and be not envious of the wicked:

content: 20 for there shall be no future to the evil man; the lamp of the wicked shall be put out.
content_old: 20 for there shall be no future to the evil man; the lamp of the wicked shall be put out.

content: 21 My son, fear Jehovah and the king: meddle not with them that are given to change.
content_old: 21 My son, fear Jehovah and the king: meddle not with them that are given to change.

content: 22 For their calamity shall rise suddenly; and who knoweth the ruin of them both?
content_old: 22 For their calamity shall rise suddenly; and who knoweth the ruin of them both?

content: 23 These things also come from the wise. It is not good to have respect of persons in judgment.
content_old: 23 These things also come from the wise. It is not good to have respect of persons in judgment.

content: 24 He that saith unto the wicked, Thou art righteous, peoples shall curse him, nations shall abhor him;
content_old: 24 He that saith unto the wicked, Thou art righteous, peoples shall curse him, nations shall abhor him;

content: 25 but to them that rebuke him shall be delight, and a good blessing cometh upon them.
content_old: 25 but to them that rebuke him shall be delight, and a good blessing cometh upon them.

content: 26 He kisseth the lips who giveth a right answer.
content_old: 26 He kisseth the lips who giveth a right answer.

content: 27 Prepare thy work without, and put thy field in order, and afterwards build thy house.
content_old: 27 Prepare thy work without, and put thy field in order, and afterwards build thy house.

content: 28 Be not a witness against thy neighbour without cause; and wouldest thou deceive with thy lips?
content_old: 28 Be not a witness against thy neighbour without cause; and wouldest thou deceive with thy lips?

content: 29 Say not, I will do so to him as he hath done to me, I will render to the man according to his work.
content_old: 29 Say not, I will do so to him as he hath done to me, I will render to the man according to his work.

content: 30 I went by the field of a sluggard, and by the vineyard of a man void of understanding;
content_old: 30 I went by the field of a sluggard, and by the vineyard of a man void of understanding;

content: 31 and lo, it was all grown over with thistles, and nettles had covered the face thereof, and its stone wall was broken down.
content_old: 31 and lo, it was all grown over with thistles, and nettles had covered the face thereof, and its stone wall was broken down.

content: 32 Then I looked, I took it to heart; I saw, I received instruction:
content_old: 32 Then I looked, I took it to heart; I saw, I received instruction:

content: 33 —A little sleep, a little slumber, a little folding of the hands to rest!
content_old: 33 —A little sleep, a little slumber, a little folding of the hands to rest!

content: 1 These are also proverbs of Solomon, which the men of Hezekiah king of Judah transcribed.
content_old: 1 These are also proverbs of Solomon, which the men of Hezekiah king of Judah transcribed.

content: 2 It is the glory of God to conceal a thing; but the glory of kings is to search out a thing.
content_old: 2 It is the glory of God to conceal a thing; but the glory of kings is to search out a thing.

content: 3 The heavens for height, and the earth for depth, and the heart of kings is unsearchable.
content_old: 3 The heavens for height, and the earth for depth, and the heart of kings is unsearchable.

content: 4 Take away the dross from the silver, and there cometh forth a vessel for the refiner:
content_old: 4 Take away the dross from the silver, and there cometh forth a vessel for the refiner:

content: 5 take away the wicked from before the king, and his throne shall be established in righteousness.
content_old: 5 take away the wicked from before the king, and his throne shall be established in righteousness.

content: 6 Put not thyself forward in the presence of the king, and stand not in the place of the great;
content_old: 6 Put not thyself forward in the presence of the king, and stand not in the place of the great;

content: 7 for better it is that it be said unto thee, Come up hither, than that thou shouldest be put lower in the presence of the prince whom thine eyes see.
content_old: 7 for better it is that it be said unto thee, Come up hither, than that thou shouldest be put lower in the presence of the prince whom thine eyes see.

content: 8 Go not forth hastily to strive, lest thou know not what to do in the end thereof, when thy neighbour hath put thee to shame.
content_old: 8 Go not forth hastily to strive, lest thou know not what to do in the end thereof, when thy neighbour hath put thee to shame.

content: 9 Debate thy cause with thy neighbour, but reveal not the secret of another;
content_old: 9 Debate thy cause with thy neighbour, but reveal not the secret of another;

content: 10 lest he that heareth it disgrace thee, and thine evil report turn not away.
content_old: 10 lest he that heareth it disgrace thee, and thine evil report turn not away.

content: 11 As apples of gold in pictures of silver, is a word spoken in season.
content_old: 11 As apples of gold in pictures of silver, is a word spoken in season.

content: 12 An ear-ring of gold, and an ornament of fine gold, is a wise reprover upon an attentive ear.
content_old: 12 An ear-ring of gold, and an ornament of fine gold, is a wise reprover upon an attentive ear.

content: 13 As the cold of snow in the time of harvest, so is a faithful messenger to them that send him: for he refresheth the soul of his masters.
content_old: 13 As the cold of snow in the time of harvest, so is a faithful messenger to them that send him: for he refresheth the soul of his masters.

content: 14 Clouds and wind without rain, so is a man that boasteth himself of a false gift.
content_old: 14 Clouds and wind without rain, so is a man that boasteth himself of a false gift.

content: 15 By long forbearing is a ruler persuaded, and a soft tongue breaketh the bone.
content_old: 15 By long forbearing is a ruler persuaded, and a soft tongue breaketh the bone.

content: 16 Hast thou found honey? Eat so much as is sufficient for thee, lest thou be surfeited therewith, and vomit it.
content_old: 16 Hast thou found honey? Eat so much as is sufficient for thee, lest thou be surfeited therewith, and vomit it.

content: 17 Let thy foot be seldom in thy neighbour’s house; lest he be weary of thee and hate thee.
content_old: 17 Let thy foot be seldom in thy neighbour’s house; lest he be weary of thee and hate thee.

content: 18 A maul, and a sword, and a sharp arrow, is a man that beareth false witness against his neighbour.
content_old: 18 A maul, and a sword, and a sharp arrow, is a man that beareth false witness against his neighbour.

content: 19 A broken tooth, and a tottering foot, is confidence in an unfaithful man in the day of trouble.
content_old: 19 A broken tooth, and a tottering foot, is confidence in an unfaithful man in the day of trouble.

content: 20 As he that taketh off a garment in cold weather, and as vinegar upon nitre, so is he that singeth songs to a sad heart.
content_old: 20 As he that taketh off a garment in cold weather, and as vinegar upon nitre, so is he that singeth songs to a sad heart.

content: 21 If thine enemy be hungry, give him bread to eat; and if he be thirsty, give him water to drink:
content_old: 21 If thine enemy be hungry, give him bread to eat; and if he be thirsty, give him water to drink:

content: 22 for thou shalt heap coals of fire upon his head, and Jehovah shall reward thee.
content_old: 22 for thou shalt heap coals of fire upon his head, and Jehovah shall reward thee.

content: 23 The north wind bringeth forth rain, and the angry countenance a backbiting tongue.
content_old: 23 The north wind bringeth forth rain, and the angry countenance a backbiting tongue.

content: 24 It is better to dwell in a corner of the housetop, than with a contentious woman, and a house in common.
content_old: 24 It is better to dwell in a corner of the housetop, than with a contentious woman, and a house in common.

content: 25 As cold waters to a thirsty soul, so is good news from a far country.
content_old: 25 As cold waters to a thirsty soul, so is good news from a far country.

content: 26 A troubled fountain, and a defiled well, is a righteous man that giveth way before the wicked.
content_old: 26 A troubled fountain, and a defiled well, is a righteous man that giveth way before the wicked.

content: 27 It is not good to eat much honey; and to search into weighty matters is itself a weight.
content_old: 27 It is not good to eat much honey; and to search into weighty matters is itself a weight.

content: 1 As snow in summer, and as rain in harvest, so honour beseemeth not a fool.
content_old: 1 As snow in summer, and as rain in harvest, so honour beseemeth not a fool.

content: 2 As the sparrow for flitting about, as the swallow for flying, so a curse undeserved shall not come.
content_old: 2 As the sparrow for flitting about, as the swallow for flying, so a curse undeserved shall not come.

content: 3 A whip for the horse, a bridle for the ass, and a rod for the back of fools.
content_old: 3 A whip for the horse, a bridle for the ass, and a rod for the back of fools.

content: 4 Answer not a fool according to his folly, lest thou also be like unto him.
content_old: 4 Answer not a fool according to his folly, lest thou also be like unto him.

content: 5 Answer a fool according to his folly, lest he be wise in his own eyes.
content_old: 5 Answer a fool according to his folly, lest he be wise in his own eyes.

content: 6 He that sendeth a message by the hand of a fool cutteth off his own feet, and drinketh damage.
content_old: 6 He that sendeth a message by the hand of a fool cutteth off his own feet, and drinketh damage.

content: 7 The legs of the lame hang loose; so is a proverb in the mouth of fools.
content_old: 7 The legs of the lame hang loose; so is a proverb in the mouth of fools.

content: 8 As a bag of gems in a stoneheap, so is he that giveth honour to a fool.
content_old: 8 As a bag of gems in a stoneheap, so is he that giveth honour to a fool.

content: 9 As a thorn goeth up into the hand of a drunkard, so is a proverb in the mouth of fools.
content_old: 9 As a thorn goeth up into the hand of a drunkard, so is a proverb in the mouth of fools.

content: 10 A master roughly worketh every one: he both hireth the fool and hireth passers-by.
content_old: 10 A master roughly worketh every one: he both hireth the fool and hireth passers-by.

content: 11 As a dog turneth back to its vomit, so a fool repeateth his folly.
content_old: 11 As a dog turneth back to its vomit, so a fool repeateth his folly.

content: 12 Hast thou seen a man wise in his own eyes? There is more hope of a fool than of him.
content_old: 12 Hast thou seen a man wise in his own eyes? There is more hope of a fool than of him.

content: 13 The sluggard saith, There is a fierce lion in the way; a lion is in the midst of the streets!
content_old: 13 The sluggard saith, There is a fierce lion in the way; a lion is in the midst of the streets!

content: 14 As the door turneth upon its hinges, so the sluggard upon his bed.
content_old: 14 As the door turneth upon its hinges, so the sluggard upon his bed.

content: 15 The sluggard burieth his hand in the dish: it wearieth him to bring it again to his mouth.
content_old: 15 The sluggard burieth his hand in the dish: it wearieth him to bring it again to his mouth.

content: 16 A sluggard is wiser in his own eyes than seven men that answer discreetly.
content_old: 16 A sluggard is wiser in his own eyes than seven men that answer discreetly.

content: 17 He that passing by vexeth himself with strife belonging not to him, is like one that taketh a dog by the ears.
content_old: 17 He that passing by vexeth himself with strife belonging not to him, is like one that taketh a dog by the ears.

content: 18 As a madman who casteth firebrands, arrows, and death,
content_old: 18 As a madman who casteth firebrands, arrows, and death,

content: 19 so is a man that deceiveth his neighbour, and saith, Am I not in sport?
content_old: 19 so is a man that deceiveth his neighbour, and saith, Am I not in sport?

content: 20 Where no wood is, the fire goeth out; and where there is no talebearer, the contention ceaseth.
content_old: 20 Where no wood is, the fire goeth out; and where there is no talebearer, the contention ceaseth.

content: 21 As coals for hot coals, and wood for fire, so is a contentious man to inflame strife.
content_old: 21 As coals for hot coals, and wood for fire, so is a contentious man to inflame strife.

content: 22 The words of a talebearer are as dainty morsels, and they go down into the innermost parts of the belly.
content_old: 22 The words of a talebearer are as dainty morsels, and they go down into the innermost parts of the belly.

content: 23 Ardent lips, and a wicked heart, are as an earthen vessel overlaid with silver dross.
content_old: 23 Ardent lips, and a wicked heart, are as an earthen vessel overlaid with silver dross.

content: 24 He that hateth dissembleth with his lips, but he layeth up deceit within him:
content_old: 24 He that hateth dissembleth with his lips, but he layeth up deceit within him:

content: 25 when his voice is gracious, believe him not, for there are seven abominations in his heart.
content_old: 25 when his voice is gracious, believe him not, for there are seven abominations in his heart.

content: 26 Though his hatred is covered by dissimulation, his wickedness shall be made manifest in the congregation.
content_old: 26 Though his hatred is covered by dissimulation, his wickedness shall be made manifest in the congregation.

content: 27 Whoso diggeth a pit shall fall therein; and he that rolleth a stone, it shall return upon him.
content_old: 27 Whoso diggeth a pit shall fall therein; and he that rolleth a stone, it shall return upon him.

content: 1 Boast not thyself of to-morrow, for thou knowest not what a day will bring forth.
content_old: 1 Boast not thyself of to-morrow, for thou knowest not what a day will bring forth.

content: 2 Let another praise thee, and not thine own mouth; a stranger, and not thine own lips.
content_old: 2 Let another praise thee, and not thine own mouth; a stranger, and not thine own lips.

content: 3 A stone is heavy, and the sand weighty; but a fool’s vexation is heavier than them both.
content_old: 3 A stone is heavy, and the sand weighty; but a fool’s vexation is heavier than them both.

content: 4 Fury is cruel, and anger is outrageous; but who is able to stand before jealousy?
content_old: 4 Fury is cruel, and anger is outrageous; but who is able to stand before jealousy?

content: 5 Open rebuke is better than hidden love.
content_old: 5 Open rebuke is better than hidden love.

content: 6 Faithful are the wounds of a friend; but the kisses of an enemy are profuse.
content_old: 6 Faithful are the wounds of a friend; but the kisses of an enemy are profuse.

content: 7 The full soul trampleth on a honeycomb; but to the hungry soul every bitter thing is sweet.
content_old: 7 The full soul trampleth on a honeycomb; but to the hungry soul every bitter thing is sweet.

content: 8 As a bird that wandereth from her nest, so is a man that wandereth from his place.
content_old: 8 As a bird that wandereth from her nest, so is a man that wandereth from his place.

content: 9 Ointment and perfume rejoice the heart; and the sweetness of one’s friend is the fruit of hearty counsel.
content_old: 9 Ointment and perfume rejoice the heart; and the sweetness of one’s friend is the fruit of hearty counsel.

content: 10 Thine own friend, and thy father’s friend, forsake not; and go not into thy brother’s house in the day of thy calamity: better is a neighbour that is near than a brother far off.
content_old: 10 Thine own friend, and thy father’s friend, forsake not; and go not into thy brother’s house in the day of thy calamity: better is a neighbour that is near than a brother far off.

content: 11 Be wise, my son, and make my heart glad, that I may have wherewith to answer him that reproacheth me.
content_old: 11 Be wise, my son, and make my heart glad, that I may have wherewith to answer him that reproacheth me.

content: 12 A prudent man seeth the evil, and hideth himself; the simple pass on, and are punished.
content_old: 12 A prudent man seeth the evil, and hideth himself; the simple pass on, and are punished.

content: 13 Take his garment that is become surety for another, and hold him in pledge for a strange woman.
content_old: 13 Take his garment that is become surety for another, and hold him in pledge for a strange woman.

content: 14 He that blesseth his friend with a loud voice, rising early in the morning, it shall be reckoned a curse to him.
content_old: 14 He that blesseth his friend with a loud voice, rising early in the morning, it shall be reckoned a curse to him.

content: 15 A continual dropping on a very rainy day and a contentious woman are alike:
content_old: 15 A continual dropping on a very rainy day and a contentious woman are alike:

content: 16 whosoever will restrain her restraineth the wind, and his right hand encountereth oil.
content_old: 16 whosoever will restrain her restraineth the wind, and his right hand encountereth oil.

content: 17 Iron is sharpened by iron; so a man sharpeneth the countenance of his friend.
content_old: 17 Iron is sharpened by iron; so a man sharpeneth the countenance of his friend.

content: 18 Whoso keepeth the fig-tree shall eat the fruit thereof; and he that guardeth his master shall be honoured.
content_old: 18 Whoso keepeth the fig-tree shall eat the fruit thereof; and he that guardeth his master shall be honoured.

content: 19 As in water face answereth to face, so the heart of man to man.
content_old: 19 As in water face answereth to face, so the heart of man to man.

content: 20 Sheol and destruction are insatiable; so the eyes of man are never satisfied.
content_old: 20 Sheol and destruction are insatiable; so the eyes of man are never satisfied.

content: 21 The fining-pot is for silver, and the furnace for gold; so let a man be to the mouth that praiseth him.
content_old: 21 The fining-pot is for silver, and the furnace for gold; so let a man be to the mouth that praiseth him.

content: 22 If thou shouldest bray a fool in a mortar among wheat with a pestle, yet will not his folly depart from him.
content_old: 22 If thou shouldest bray a fool in a mortar among wheat with a pestle, yet will not his folly depart from him.

content: 23 Be well acquainted with the appearance of thy flocks; look well to thy herds:
content_old: 23 Be well acquainted with the appearance of thy flocks; look well to thy herds:

content: 24 for wealth is not for ever; and doth the crown endure from generation to generation?
content_old: 24 for wealth is not for ever; and doth the crown endure from generation to generation?

content: 25 The hay is removed, and the tender grass sheweth itself, and herbs of the mountains are gathered in.
content_old: 25 The hay is removed, and the tender grass sheweth itself, and herbs of the mountains are gathered in.

content: 26 The lambs are for thy clothing, and the goats are the price of a field;
content_old: 26 The lambs are for thy clothing, and the goats are the price of a field;

content: 1 The wicked flee when no man pursueth; but the righteous are bold as a lion.
content_old: 1 The wicked flee when no man pursueth; but the righteous are bold as a lion.

content: 2 By the transgression of a land many are the princes thereof; but by a man of understanding and of knowledge, its stability is prolonged.
content_old: 2 By the transgression of a land many are the princes thereof; but by a man of understanding and of knowledge, its stability is prolonged.

content: 3 A poor man who oppresseth the helpless is a sweeping rain which leaveth no food.
content_old: 3 A poor man who oppresseth the helpless is a sweeping rain which leaveth no food.

content: 4 They that forsake the law praise the wicked; but such as keep the law contend with them.
content_old: 4 They that forsake the law praise the wicked; but such as keep the law contend with them.

content: 5 Evil men understand not judgment; but they that seek Jehovah understand everything.
content_old: 5 Evil men understand not judgment; but they that seek Jehovah understand everything.

content: 6 Better is the poor that walketh in his integrity, than he that is perverse, double in ways, though he be rich.
content_old: 6 Better is the poor that walketh in his integrity, than he that is perverse, double in ways, though he be rich.

content: 7 Whoso observeth the law is a son that hath understanding; but he that is a companion of profligates bringeth shame to his father.
content_old: 7 Whoso observeth the law is a son that hath understanding; but he that is a companion of profligates bringeth shame to his father.

content: 8 He that by usury and unjust gain increaseth his substance gathereth it for him that is gracious to the poor.
content_old: 8 He that by usury and unjust gain increaseth his substance gathereth it for him that is gracious to the poor.

content: 9 He that turneth away his ear from hearing the law, even his prayer is an abomination.
content_old: 9 He that turneth away his ear from hearing the law, even his prayer is an abomination.

content: 10 Whoso causeth the upright to go astray in an evil way, shall himself fall into his own pit; but the perfect shall inherit good.
content_old: 10 Whoso causeth the upright to go astray in an evil way, shall himself fall into his own pit; but the perfect shall inherit good.

content: 11 A rich man is wise in his own eyes; but the poor that hath understanding searcheth him out.
content_old: 11 A rich man is wise in his own eyes; but the poor that hath understanding searcheth him out.

content: 12 When the righteous triumph, there is great glory; but when the wicked rise, men conceal themselves.
content_old: 12 When the righteous triumph, there is great glory; but when the wicked rise, men conceal themselves.

content: 13 He that covereth his transgressions shall not prosper; but whoso confesseth and forsaketh them shall obtain mercy.
content_old: 13 He that covereth his transgressions shall not prosper; but whoso confesseth and forsaketh them shall obtain mercy.

content: 14 Happy is the man that feareth always; but he that hardeneth his heart shall fall into evil.
content_old: 14 Happy is the man that feareth always; but he that hardeneth his heart shall fall into evil.

content: 15 A roaring lion, and a ranging bear, is a wicked ruler over a poor people.
content_old: 15 A roaring lion, and a ranging bear, is a wicked ruler over a poor people.

content: 16 The prince void of intelligence is also a great oppressor: he that hateth covetousness shall prolong his days.
content_old: 16 The prince void of intelligence is also a great oppressor: he that hateth covetousness shall prolong his days.

content: 17 A man laden with the blood of any person, fleeth to the pit: let no man stay him.
content_old: 17 A man laden with the blood of any person, fleeth to the pit: let no man stay him.

content: 18 Whoso walketh in integrity shall be saved; but he that is perverted in his double ways, shall fall in one of them.
content_old: 18 Whoso walketh in integrity shall be saved; but he that is perverted in his double ways, shall fall in one of them.

content: 19 He that tilleth his land shall be satisfied with bread; but he that followeth the worthless shall have poverty enough.
content_old: 19 He that tilleth his land shall be satisfied with bread; but he that followeth the worthless shall have poverty enough.

content: 20 A faithful man aboundeth with blessings; but he that maketh haste to be rich shall not be innocent.
content_old: 20 A faithful man aboundeth with blessings; but he that maketh haste to be rich shall not be innocent.

content: 21 To have respect of persons is not good; but for a piece of bread will a man transgress.
content_old: 21 To have respect of persons is not good; but for a piece of bread will a man transgress.

content: 22 He that hath an evil eye hasteth after wealth, and knoweth not that poverty shall come upon him.
content_old: 22 He that hath an evil eye hasteth after wealth, and knoweth not that poverty shall come upon him.

content: 23 He that rebuketh a man shall afterwards find more favour than he that flattereth with the tongue.
content_old: 23 He that rebuketh a man shall afterwards find more favour than he that flattereth with the tongue.

content: 24 Whoso robbeth his father and his mother, and saith, It is no transgression, the same is the companion of a destroyer.
content_old: 24 Whoso robbeth his father and his mother, and saith, It is no transgression, the same is the companion of a destroyer.

content: 25 He that is puffed up in soul exciteth contention; but he that relieth upon Jehovah shall be made fat.
content_old: 25 He that is puffed up in soul exciteth contention; but he that relieth upon Jehovah shall be made fat.

content: 26 He that confideth in his own heart is a fool; but whoso walketh wisely, he shall be delivered.
content_old: 26 He that confideth in his own heart is a fool; but whoso walketh wisely, he shall be delivered.

content: 27 He that giveth unto the poor shall not lack; but he that withdraweth his eyes shall have many a curse.
content_old: 27 He that giveth unto the poor shall not lack; but he that withdraweth his eyes shall have many a curse.

content: 1 He that being often reproved hardeneth his neck, shall suddenly be destroyed, and without remedy.
content_old: 1 He that being often reproved hardeneth his neck, shall suddenly be destroyed, and without remedy.

content: 2 When the righteous increase, the people rejoice; but when the wicked beareth rule, the people mourn.
content_old: 2 When the righteous increase, the people rejoice; but when the wicked beareth rule, the people mourn.

content: 3 Whoso loveth wisdom rejoiceth his father; but he that is a companion of harlots destroyeth his substance.
content_old: 3 Whoso loveth wisdom rejoiceth his father; but he that is a companion of harlots destroyeth his substance.

content: 4 A king by just judgment establisheth the land; but he that taketh gifts overthroweth it.
content_old: 4 A king by just judgment establisheth the land; but he that taketh gifts overthroweth it.

content: 5 A man that flattereth his neighbour spreadeth a net for his steps.
content_old: 5 A man that flattereth his neighbour spreadeth a net for his steps.

content: 6 In the transgression of an evil man there is a snare; but the righteous shall sing and rejoice.
content_old: 6 In the transgression of an evil man there is a snare; but the righteous shall sing and rejoice.

content: 7 The righteous taketh knowledge of the cause of the poor; the wicked understandeth not knowledge.
content_old: 7 The righteous taketh knowledge of the cause of the poor; the wicked understandeth not knowledge.

content: 8 Scornful men set the city in a flame; but the wise turn away anger.
content_old: 8 Scornful men set the city in a flame; but the wise turn away anger.

content: 9 If a wise man contendeth with a fool, whether he rage or laugh, he hath no rest.
content_old: 9 If a wise man contendeth with a fool, whether he rage or laugh, he hath no rest.

content: 10 The bloodthirsty hate the perfect, but the upright care for his soul.
content_old: 10 The bloodthirsty hate the perfect, but the upright care for his soul.

content: 11 A fool uttereth all his mind; but a wise man keepeth it back.
content_old: 11 A fool uttereth all his mind; but a wise man keepeth it back.

content: 12 If a ruler hearken to lying words, all his servants are wicked.
content_old: 12 If a ruler hearken to lying words, all his servants are wicked.

content: 13 The indigent and the oppressor meet together; Jehovah lighteneth the eyes of them both.
content_old: 13 The indigent and the oppressor meet together; Jehovah lighteneth the eyes of them both.

content: 14 A king that faithfully judgeth the poor, his throne shall be established for ever.
content_old: 14 A king that faithfully judgeth the poor, his throne shall be established for ever.

content: 15 The rod and reproof give wisdom; but a child left to himself bringeth his mother to shame.
content_old: 15 The rod and reproof give wisdom; but a child left to himself bringeth his mother to shame.

content: 16 When the wicked increase, transgression increaseth; but the righteous shall see their fall.
content_old: 16 When the wicked increase, transgression increaseth; but the righteous shall see their fall.

content: 17 Chasten thy son, and he shall give thee rest, and shall give delight unto thy soul.
content_old: 17 Chasten thy son, and he shall give thee rest, and shall give delight unto thy soul.

content: 18 Where there is no vision the people cast off restraint; but happy is he that keepeth the law.
content_old: 18 Where there is no vision the people cast off restraint; but happy is he that keepeth the law.

content: 19 A servant is not corrected by words: he understandeth indeed, but he will not answer.
content_old: 19 A servant is not corrected by words: he understandeth indeed, but he will not answer.

content: 20 Hast thou seen a man hasty in his words? there is more hope of a fool than of him.
content_old: 20 Hast thou seen a man hasty in his words? there is more hope of a fool than of him.

content: 21 He that delicately bringeth up his servant from a child, shall in the end have him as a son.
content_old: 21 He that delicately bringeth up his servant from a child, shall in the end have him as a son.

content: 22 An angry man exciteth contention; and a furious man aboundeth in transgression.
content_old: 22 An angry man exciteth contention; and a furious man aboundeth in transgression.

content: 23 A man’s pride bringeth him low; but the humble in spirit shall obtain honour.
content_old: 23 A man’s pride bringeth him low; but the humble in spirit shall obtain honour.

content: 24 Whoso shareth with a thief hateth his own soul: he heareth the adjuration, and declareth not.
content_old: 24 Whoso shareth with a thief hateth his own soul: he heareth the adjuration, and declareth not.

content: 25 The fear of man bringeth a snare; but whoso putteth his confidence in Jehovah is protected.
content_old: 25 The fear of man bringeth a snare; but whoso putteth his confidence in Jehovah is protected.

content: 26 Many seek the ruler’s face; but a man’s right judgment is from Jehovah.
content_old: 26 Many seek the ruler’s face; but a man’s right judgment is from Jehovah.

content: 1 The words of Agur the son of Jakeh; the prophecy uttered by the man unto Ithiel, even unto Ithiel and Ucal:
content_old: 1 The words of Agur the son of Jakeh; the prophecy uttered by the man unto Ithiel, even unto Ithiel and Ucal:

content: 2 Truly I am more stupid than any one; and I have not a man’s intelligence.
content_old: 2 Truly I am more stupid than any one; and I have not a man’s intelligence.

content: 3 I have neither learned wisdom, nor have I the knowledge of the Holy.
content_old: 3 I have neither learned wisdom, nor have I the knowledge of the Holy.

content: 4 Who hath ascended up into the heavens, and descended? Who hath gathered the wind in his fists? Who hath bound the waters in a mantle? Who hath established all the ends of the earth? What is his name, and what is his son’s name, if thou knowest?
content_old: 4 Who hath ascended up into the heavens, and descended? Who hath gathered the wind in his fists? Who hath bound the waters in a mantle? Who hath established all the ends of the earth? What is his name, and what is his son’s name, if thou knowest?

content: 5 Every word of †God is pure: he is a shield unto them that put their trust in him.
content_old: 5 Every word of †God is pure: he is a shield unto them that put their trust in him.

content: 6 Add thou not unto his words, lest he reprove thee, and thou be found a liar.
content_old: 6 Add thou not unto his words, lest he reprove thee, and thou be found a liar.

content: 7 Two things do I ask of thee; deny me them not before I die:
content_old: 7 Two things do I ask of thee; deny me them not before I die:

content: 8 Remove far from me vanity and lies; give me neither poverty nor riches; feed me with the bread of my daily need:
content_old: 8 Remove far from me vanity and lies; give me neither poverty nor riches; feed me with the bread of my daily need:

content: 9 lest I be full and deny thee, and say, Who is Jehovah? or lest I be poor and steal, and outrage the name of my God.
content_old: 9 lest I be full and deny thee, and say, Who is Jehovah? or lest I be poor and steal, and outrage the name of my God.

content: 10 Speak not too much about a servant to his master, lest he curse thee, and thou be held guilty.
content_old: 10 Speak not too much about a servant to his master, lest he curse thee, and thou be held guilty.

content: 11 There is a generation that curseth their father, and doth not bless their mother;
content_old: 11 There is a generation that curseth their father, and doth not bless their mother;

content: 12 there is a generation that are pure in their own eyes, yet are not washed from their filthiness;
content_old: 12 there is a generation that are pure in their own eyes, yet are not washed from their filthiness;

content: 13 there is a generation, —how lofty are their eyes, how their eyelids are lifted up!
content_old: 13 there is a generation, —how lofty are their eyes, how their eyelids are lifted up!

content: 14 —a generation whose teeth are swords, and their jaw-teeth knives, to devour the afflicted from off the earth, and the needy from among men.
content_old: 14 —a generation whose teeth are swords, and their jaw-teeth knives, to devour the afflicted from off the earth, and the needy from among men.

content: 15 The leech hath two daughters: Give, give. There are three things never satisfied; four which say not, It is enough:
content_old: 15 The leech hath two daughters: Give, give. There are three things never satisfied; four which say not, It is enough:

content: 16 —Sheol, and the barren womb; the earth which is not filled with water, and the fire which saith not, It is enough.
content_old: 16 —Sheol, and the barren womb; the earth which is not filled with water, and the fire which saith not, It is enough.

content: 17 The eye that mocketh at a father, and despiseth to obey a mother, the ravens of the valley shall pick it out, and the young eagles shall eat it.
content_old: 17 The eye that mocketh at a father, and despiseth to obey a mother, the ravens of the valley shall pick it out, and the young eagles shall eat it.

content: 18 There are three things too wonderful for me, and four that I know not:
content_old: 18 There are three things too wonderful for me, and four that I know not:

content: 19 The way of an eagle in the heavens, the way of a serpent upon a rock, the way of a ship in the midst of the sea, and the way of a man with a maid.
content_old: 19 The way of an eagle in the heavens, the way of a serpent upon a rock, the way of a ship in the midst of the sea, and the way of a man with a maid.

content: 20 Such is the way of an adulterous woman: she eateth, and wipeth her mouth, and saith, I have done no wickedness.
content_old: 20 Such is the way of an adulterous woman: she eateth, and wipeth her mouth, and saith, I have done no wickedness.

content: 21 Under three things the earth is disquieted, and under four it cannot bear up:
content_old: 21 Under three things the earth is disquieted, and under four it cannot bear up:

content: 22 Under a servant when he reigneth, and a churl when he is filled with meat;
content_old: 22 Under a servant when he reigneth, and a churl when he is filled with meat;

content: 23 under an odious woman when she is married, and a handmaid when she is heir to her mistress.
content_old: 23 under an odious woman when she is married, and a handmaid when she is heir to her mistress.

content: 24 There are four things little upon the earth, and they are exceeding wise:
content_old: 24 There are four things little upon the earth, and they are exceeding wise:

content: 25 The ants, a people not strong, yet they provide their food in the summer;
content_old: 25 The ants, a people not strong, yet they provide their food in the summer;

content: 26 the rock-badgers are but a feeble folk, yet they make their house in the cliff;
content_old: 26 the rock-badgers are but a feeble folk, yet they make their house in the cliff;

content: 27 the locusts have no king, yet they go forth all of them by bands;
content_old: 27 the locusts have no king, yet they go forth all of them by bands;

content: 28 thou takest hold of the lizard with the hands, yet is she in kings’ palaces.
content_old: 28 thou takest hold of the lizard with the hands, yet is she in kings’ palaces.

content: 29 There are three things which have a stately step, and four are comely in going:
content_old: 29 There are three things which have a stately step, and four are comely in going:

content: 30 The lion, mighty among beasts, which turneth not away for any;
content_old: 30 The lion, mighty among beasts, which turneth not away for any;

content: 31 a horse girt in the loins; or the he-goat; and a king, against whom none can rise up.
content_old: 31 a horse girt in the loins; or the he-goat; and a king, against whom none can rise up.

content: 32 If thou hast done foolishly in lifting up thyself, or if thou hast thought evil, lay the hand upon thy mouth.
content_old: 32 If thou hast done foolishly in lifting up thyself, or if thou hast thought evil, lay the hand upon thy mouth.

content: 1 The words of king Lemuel, the prophecy that his mother taught him:
content_old: 1 The words of king Lemuel, the prophecy that his mother taught him:

content: 2 What, my son? and what, O son of my womb? and what, O son of my vows?
content_old: 2 What, my son? and what, O son of my womb? and what, O son of my vows?

content: 3 Give not thy strength unto women, nor thy ways to them that destroy kings.
content_old: 3 Give not thy strength unto women, nor thy ways to them that destroy kings.

content: 4 It is not for kings, Lemuel, it is not for kings to drink wine, nor for rulers to say, Where is the strong drink?
content_old: 4 It is not for kings, Lemuel, it is not for kings to drink wine, nor for rulers to say, Where is the strong drink?

content: 5 —lest they drink and forget the law, and pervert the judgment of any of the children of affliction.
content_old: 5 —lest they drink and forget the law, and pervert the judgment of any of the children of affliction.

content: 6 Give strong drink unto him that is ready to perish, and wine unto the bitter of soul:
content_old: 6 Give strong drink unto him that is ready to perish, and wine unto the bitter of soul:

content: 7 let him drink, and forget his poverty, and remember his misery no more.
content_old: 7 let him drink, and forget his poverty, and remember his misery no more.

content: 8 Open thy mouth for the dumb, for the cause of all those that are left desolate.
content_old: 8 Open thy mouth for the dumb, for the cause of all those that are left desolate.

content: 9 Open thy mouth, judge righteously, and minister justice to the afflicted and needy.
content_old: 9 Open thy mouth, judge righteously, and minister justice to the afflicted and needy.

content: 10 Who can find a woman of worth? for her price is far above rubies.
content_old: 10 Who can find a woman of worth? for her price is far above rubies.

content: 11 The heart of her husband confideth in her, and he shall have no lack of spoil.
content_old: 11 The heart of her husband confideth in her, and he shall have no lack of spoil.

content: 12 She doeth him good, and not evil, all the days of her life.
content_old: 12 She doeth him good, and not evil, all the days of her life.

content: 13 She seeketh wool and flax, and worketh willingly with her hands.
content_old: 13 She seeketh wool and flax, and worketh willingly with her hands.

content: 14 She is like the merchants’ ships: she bringeth her food from afar;
content_old: 14 She is like the merchants’ ships: she bringeth her food from afar;

content: 15 And she riseth while it is yet night, and giveth meat to her household, and the day’s work to her maidens.
content_old: 15 And she riseth while it is yet night, and giveth meat to her household, and the day’s work to her maidens.

content: 16 She considereth a field, and acquireth it; of the fruit of her hands she planteth a vineyard.
content_old: 16 She considereth a field, and acquireth it; of the fruit of her hands she planteth a vineyard.

content: 17 She girdeth her loins with strength, and maketh strong her arms.
content_old: 17 She girdeth her loins with strength, and maketh strong her arms.

content: 18 She perceiveth that her earning is good; her lamp goeth not out by night.
content_old: 18 She perceiveth that her earning is good; her lamp goeth not out by night.

content: 19 She putteth her hands to the distaff, and her hands hold the spindle.
content_old: 19 She putteth her hands to the distaff, and her hands hold the spindle.

content: 20 She stretcheth out her hand to the afflicted, and she reacheth forth her hands to the needy.
content_old: 20 She stretcheth out her hand to the afflicted, and she reacheth forth her hands to the needy.

content: 21 She is not afraid of the snow for her household; for all her household are clothed with scarlet.
content_old: 21 She is not afraid of the snow for her household; for all her household are clothed with scarlet.

content: 22 She maketh herself coverlets; her clothing is byssus and purple.
content_old: 22 She maketh herself coverlets; her clothing is byssus and purple.

content: 23 Her husband is known in the gates, when he sitteth among the elders of the land.
content_old: 23 Her husband is known in the gates, when he sitteth among the elders of the land.

content: 24 She maketh body linen and selleth it, and delivereth girdles unto the merchant.
content_old: 24 She maketh body linen and selleth it, and delivereth girdles unto the merchant.

content: 25 Strength and dignity are her clothing, and she laugheth at the coming day.
content_old: 25 Strength and dignity are her clothing, and she laugheth at the coming day.

content: 26 She openeth her mouth with wisdom; and upon her tongue is the law of kindness.
content_old: 26 She openeth her mouth with wisdom; and upon her tongue is the law of kindness.

content: 27 She surveyeth the ways of her household, and eateth not the bread of idleness.
content_old: 27 She surveyeth the ways of her household, and eateth not the bread of idleness.

content: 28 Her children rise up and call her blessed; her husband also, and he praiseth her:
content_old: 28 Her children rise up and call her blessed; her husband also, and he praiseth her:

content: 29 Many daughters have done worthily, but thou excellest them all.
content_old: 29 Many daughters have done worthily, but thou excellest them all.

content: 30 Gracefulness is deceitful and beauty is vain; a woman that feareth Jehovah, she shall be praised.
content_old: 30 Gracefulness is deceitful and beauty is vain; a woman that feareth Jehovah, she shall be praised.
